subject: MariaDB10 breaks with migrate version 065
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-26 16:18:38.000000000', 'files': ['heat/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/065_update_at_fsp.py'], 'message': 'MariaDB10 breaks with migrate version 065

MariaDB10 does not yet support dialects (as of 10.0.21) yet it would
have this migration applied breaking the created_at and updated_at
fetching.

This patch updates the check to not apply to any mysql database > 10

Once MariaDB support this feature, we can update the check with a
minor number to start applying this migration.

Change-Id: Ia13d16a9abd1d05da02266e2284db09ad7ef35f2
Closes-Bug: #1488779
'}]
commit_message:
MariaDB10 breaks with migrate version 065

MariaDB10 does not yet support dialects (as of 10.0.21) yet it would
have this migration applied breaking the created_at and updated_at
fetching.

This patch updates the check to not apply to any mysql database > 10

Once MariaDB support this feature, we can update the check with a
minor number to start applying this migration.

Change-Id: Ia13d16a9abd1d05da02266e2284db09ad7ef35f2
Closes-Bug: #1488779

commit_message:
Fix column width for Firewalls' drag and drop forms

Firewalls' "Add Policy" and "Create Firewall" forms have columns
with drag and drop mechanisms: "Rules" and "Routers". This patch
fixes width of these columns.

Change-Id: Ib3054a9aab8ce3cc067f731147a3d2f1a6355240
Closes-Bug: #1472167

commit_message:
Enable YARN ResourceManager HA in CDH plugin

We add the codes about YARN RM HA implementation. If
YARN_STANDBYRM role is enabled in cluster, we will do some
validation, and call CM API enable_rm_ha to enable RM HA in the
cluster.

Partial-implements: blueprint cdh-ha-support
Change-Id: I5562a310ef5b6fffa3439b28db2ceb212cc6286f

commit_message:
Change native ASG to inherit from ResourceGroup

This is part of a sequence of changes[1] to refactor ASG . This
change makes OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup inherit
OS::Heat:ResourceGroup rather than AWS ASG.

[1]
- Add rolling_update to ResourceGroup
- Convert ASG to inherit from ResourceGroup
- Remove inheritance and refactor common routines
  to utility

Change-Id: Ia9b7f97e38e48d5f7eb922f425e804adef068815

- Remove inheritance and Refactor common routines

commit_message:
Remove inheritance and refactor common functions to utility

This is part of a sequence of changes[1] to refactor ASG . This
change removes the inheritance model fro ASG & RG and refactors
common routines to utility module.

[1]
- Add rolling_update to ResourceGroup
- Convert ASG to inherit from ResourceGroup
- Remove inheritance and Refactor common routines
  to utility

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-25 08:31:12.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/quota/resource.py'], 'message': 'Quota enforcement: remove locks on _dirty_tenants

This lock was used to avoid errors due to list contents changing
during iteration, but is causing issues with pymysql. This patch
proposes an alternative approach which makes the use of a lock
unnecessary.

With this change a copy of the dirty_tenants set is made before
setting the dirty bit on resources, and then the mark_dirty routine
operates on this copy. This still guaranteses operations
correctness, as all the tenants that should be marked dirty are
marked dirty before the completion of the relevant API request.

Related-Blueprint: better-quotas

Change-Id: Ib39e7089889d3f906bdc025c843128a1fa3e8797
'}]
commit_message:
Quota enforcement: remove locks on _dirty_tenants

This lock was used to avoid errors due to list contents changing
during iteration, but is causing issues with pymysql. This patch
proposes an alternative approach which makes the use of a lock
unnecessary.

With this change a copy of the dirty_tenants set is made before
setting the dirty bit on resources, and then the mark_dirty routine
operates on this copy. This still guaranteses operations
correctness, as all the tenants that should be marked dirty are
marked dirty before the completion of the relevant API request.

Related-Blueprint: better-quotas

Change-Id: Ib39e7089889d3f906bdc025c843128a1fa3e8797

subject: Fix mysql_engine and FK in *_token tables
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-12 13:54:09.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/contrib/oauth1/migrate_repo/versions/006_fix_token_tables_engine.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_sync_migrations.py'], 'message': 'Fix mysql_engine and FK in *_token tables

Migration 002 adds foreign keys to tables request_token and
access_token. These FKs were mentioned in model description as well -
see [1] and [2].
But these tables was created without mysql_engine argument, so
database creates table with default engine.
In MySQL 5.5 default engine is MyISAM, so foreign keys can not be
created for them. We must use InnoDB engine to allow foreign keys.

Added migration to fix mysql_engine and add foreign keys.

[1] - https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/8bb63620b4d9ec71b0a60ed705938103d7d3c2c2/keystone/contrib/oauth1/backends/sql.py#L53-L54
[2] - https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/8bb63620b4d9ec71b0a60ed705938103d7d3c2c2/keystone/contrib/oauth1/backends/sql.py#L76-L77

Change-Id: I9b2cd319f4aa7e1dd1580ef8895141d9779e011f
Related-Bug: #1292591
'}]
commit_message:
Fix mysql_engine and FK in *_token tables

Migration 002 adds foreign keys to tables request_token and
access_token. These FKs were mentioned in model description as well -
see [1] and [2].
But these tables was created without mysql_engine argument, so
database creates table with default engine.
In MySQL 5.5 default engine is MyISAM, so foreign keys can not be
created for them. We must use InnoDB engine to allow foreign keys.

Added migration to fix mysql_engine and add foreign keys.

[1] - https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/8bb63620b4d9ec71b0a60ed705938103d7d3c2c2/keystone/contrib/oauth1/backends/sql.py#L53-L54
[2] - https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/8bb63620b4d9ec71b0a60ed705938103d7d3c2c2/keystone/contrib/oauth1/backends/sql.py#L76-L77

Change-Id: I9b2cd319f4aa7e1dd1580ef8895141d9779e011f
Related-Bug: #1292591

subject: Fix mysql_engine and FK in project_endpoint_group table
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-16 13:44:12.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/contrib/endpoint_filter/migrate_repo/versions/003_fix_endpoint_groups_mysql_engine.py'], 'message': 'Fix mysql_engine and FK in project_endpoint_group table

Table project_endpoint_group was created with foreign key and this was
mentioned in model description as well. But table was created without
mysql_engine argument, so database creates table with default engine.
In MySQL 5.5 default engine is MyISAM, so table creates without any
foreign keys.

Added migration to fix mysql_engine and add foreign key.

Change-Id: Idd73759ebf5fa17aadb68e97c18a0b9c43e7f986
Related-Bug: #1292591
'}]
commit_message:
Fix mysql_engine and FK in project_endpoint_group table

Table project_endpoint_group was created with foreign key and this was
mentioned in model description as well. But table was created without
mysql_engine argument, so database creates table with default engine.
In MySQL 5.5 default engine is MyISAM, so table creates without any
foreign keys.

Added migration to fix mysql_engine and add foreign key.

Change-Id: Idd73759ebf5fa17aadb68e97c18a0b9c43e7f986
Related-Bug: #1292591

commit_message:
Add server_default to relay_state_prefix in service_provider model

Change I55fe059df8b73e8c6d1f195a958e73ee0a321015 added
`relay_state_prefix` column to `service_provider` table, but in model
description in ServiceProviderModel class was missed `server_default`
argument for this column.

Newer releases of Apache Httpd server prefer to use sites-available /

commit_message:
Update Httpd configuration docs for sites-available/enabled

Newer releases of Apache Httpd server prefer to use sites-available /
sites-enabled configuration directories, but the Apache setup
documentation was still using conf.d. This change updates the Apache
setup documentation to use the preferred method.

Change-Id: I00a4cef2e4194b07f12ed0c0f6c584f236771a00

commit_message:
HP 3PAR add more info to the share comment

Put host and original name in comment to help
troubleshoot and clean up test systems.

Implements blueprint: hp3par-share-comment

Change-Id: Ibdbb561553086eeb6da4b94254b1d643b39b767a

commit_message:
Support dhcp metadata service for all networks

Vendors implementing Neutron L3 API in their devices may not be able to provide
metadata server access via the Neutron router. In such cases we want to allow
the metadata service as done for non-isolated networks segments.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I5f6ee9788717c3d4f1f2e2a4b9734fdd8dd92b40
Closes-Bug:#1483939
(cherry picked from commit 09b09de925a69bdb4f83b3709b83634f98d8d99f)

subject: Set up new selenium job for Horizon
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-08-27 05:58:25.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/horizon.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Set up new selenium job for Horizon

This job hands off management of the X virtual frame buffer to
Horizon. The interaction between the run-selenium.sh xvfb
management and Horizon's (necessary for dev reasons) was causing
the whole thing to not work.

Remove the gate-horizon-selenium job which wasn't running any
tests anyway, and add in a new job gate-horizon-selenium-headless.

The new job name is to ensure we aren't still running the old job
and to not be confused with the selenium job template.

Change-Id: I370880c17210c4a2d203913cdb49de1804ccf709
Co-Authored-By: Joshua Hesketh <josh@nitrotech.org>
"}]
commit_message:
Set up new selenium job for Horizon

This job hands off management of the X virtual frame buffer to
Horizon. The interaction between the run-selenium.sh xvfb
management and Horizon's (necessary for dev reasons) was causing
the whole thing to not work.

Remove the gate-horizon-selenium job which wasn't running any
tests anyway, and add in a new job gate-horizon-selenium-headless.

The new job name is to ensure we aren't still running the old job
and to not be confused with the selenium job template.

Change-Id: I370880c17210c4a2d203913cdb49de1804ccf709
Co-Authored-By: Joshua Hesketh <josh@nitrotech.org>

commit_message:
libvirt: clean code of NOTE tags

Nova has more than 1200 NOTEs and some of them are just comments

This commit clean libvirt's code of tags when no action are required
or if it's not a workaround or a kind of hack. Not necessary to use
this tag when it's a simple comment.

Change-Id: I1cccb9bb0af013e7762e3246a81ebaf97abd3877

Change-Id: Ia347dd8266857dc54aa542a45f2c873de4925614

commit_message:
Rename Mistral dashboard to Workflow

We register mistral as workflow service to keystone, so use 'Workflow'
makes more sense than 'Mistral' as a dashboard name, just like we don't
call compute dashboard 'Nova'.

Change-Id: Ia347dd8266857dc54aa542a45f2c873de4925614

commit_message:
Allow calling obj_to_primitive() with version_manifest

When we call obj_to_primitive() on an object, we need to be able to
pass in the version_manifest so that the backport happens according
to those versions. This merely adds an optional argument which, if
present, calls the new interface.

Change-Id: I016a8061825507751168b6a59e092c9db5b0b19f

On last midcycle meetup was decided to make snapshots optional feature.

Features:

   calculated from the fact of redefinition of three main driver
   methods for snapshots 'create_snapshot', 'delete_snapshot' and
   'create_share_from_snapshot'.

  to 'True'

  to exist

  share type that has extra spec 'snapshot_support' equal to 'False'.

  to all share types that do not have it yet.

Change-Id: I069d9e911c7d7a708fa518b38ed10572a45e5f42

commit_message:
Add possibility to filter back ends by snapshot support

On last midcycle meetup was decided to make snapshots optional feature.

Features:
 - Add new boolean capability 'snapshot_support' to base share driver
   so every existing share driver will inherit it. Make value of it be
   calculated from the fact of redefinition of three main driver
   methods for snapshots 'create_snapshot', 'delete_snapshot' and
   'create_share_from_snapshot'.
- Set extra spec 'snapshot_support' with share type creation by default
  to 'True'
- Restrict deletion of extra spec 'snapshot_support' that is expected
  to exist
- Allow to redefine new extra spec 'snapshot_support'
- Restrict API 'snapshot create' for share created with
  share type that has extra spec 'snapshot_support' equal to 'False'.
- Add migration where new extra spec 'snapshot_support' is added
  to all share types that do not have it yet.

Partially implements bp snapshots-optional
Change-Id: I069d9e911c7d7a708fa518b38ed10572a45e5f42

commit_message:
django.contrib.formtools import error with django 1.8

Horizon Kilo version works with Django 1.8. If you install
murano-dashboard in an existing Horizon instance with
Django 1.8, httpd daemon will raise errors:

ImportError: No module named formtools.wizard

This issue is related to
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.8/ref/contrib/formtools/

Change-Id: I21703f2bcdb14401d205b7ff1958c1875c7bbd44
Closes-Bug: #1488404

commit_message:
This adds proxy feature in magnum client

This is a patch to add http_proxy, https_proxy
and no_proxy as option in command line. So that
proxy values can be given while creating
baymodel as command line arguments

Implements: blueprint add-proxy
Closes-Bug: #1476843

Change-Id: Ide91a25d9ddd5093b0696ac82fc373082983979e

commit_message:
Don't pass the service catalog when making glance requests

If your service catalog has too many endpoints in it, passing this in
the request to glance can result in a 400 because the header is too big.

This isn't even necessary to pass to glance since we use the auth_token
middleware.

Per bknudson: "Any service using the auth_token middleware has no use
for the x-service-catalog header. All that auth_token middleware uses is
x-auth-token. The auth_token middleware will actually strip the
x-service-catalog from the request before it sends the request on to the
rest of the pipeline, so the application will never see it."

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/image/test_glance.py
        nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/image/test_glance.py
        nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/test_vm_utils.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflicts in the tests are due to the test modules
all being moved in kilo, otherwise there are no differences.

Closes-Bug: #1482699

Change-Id: I204c6f61194bef6eba01ab0525bc80fa2e323acd
(cherry picked from commit 4fa9bc1c544af30f167499284fc3e8ff6b65d23f)
(cherry picked from commit 9724d506bd9c478b757874b1de80f4e9fb7d7743)

commit_message:
Don't pass the service catalog when making glance requests

If your service catalog has too many endpoints in it, passing this in
the request to glance can result in a 400 because the header is too big.

This isn't even necessary to pass to glance since we use the auth_token
middleware.

Per bknudson: "Any service using the auth_token middleware has no use
for the x-service-catalog header. All that auth_token middleware uses is
x-auth-token. The auth_token middleware will actually strip the
x-service-catalog from the request before it sends the request on to the
rest of the pipeline, so the application will never see it."

Closes-Bug: #1482699

Change-Id: I204c6f61194bef6eba01ab0525bc80fa2e323acd
(cherry picked from commit 4fa9bc1c544af30f167499284fc3e8ff6b65d23f)

commit_message:
Ensure working dir is on driver class path for Spark/Swift

For Spark/Swift integration, we use a wrapper class to set up
the hadoop environment.  For this to succeed, the current
working directory must be on the classpath. Newer versions of
Spark have changed how the default classpath is generated, so
Sahara must ensure explicitly that the working dir will be
included.

Change-Id: I6680bf8736cada93e87821ef37de3c3b4202ead4

commit_message:
Saves output of run_tests.sh to .log file

Uses data automatically generated by testr to implement logging of run_tests
script. Added options to script that allow logging (-l)  of only failed tests
(default) or of all tests (-a). Saves last test in run_tests.log.bak file.

Change-Id: I8e71f57f6917676748ed88c7670895c486717710
Closes-Bug: #1219690

commit_message:
Service Instance: Add instance reboot method

This patch adds a method in the Service Instance manager class,
responsible of rebooting service instances.

This will be used by the soon to be introduced Windows Driver.

Change-Id: Id82803339f5ddfef64eaf30a72d2c1632c4c6a9b
Partially-implements: blueprint windows-smb-support

revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2015-07-23 07:39:05.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/enable-new-agents.rst'], 'message': "Add enable_new_agents to neutron server

Neutron doesn't have a way to test a newly added network node by deploying test
resource before any customer resource on the node is deployed. Nova and Cinder
has the setting of ‚Äúenable_new_services‚Äù in each conf to disable the initial
service status to achieve this. This proposal adds enable_new_agents config.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I84c1a152c5d0cc120b7076f50079cde1395a206c
Implements: blueprint enable-new-agents
Related-Bug: 1472076
"}]
commit_message:
Add enable_new_agents to neutron server

Neutron doesn't have a way to test a newly added network node by deploying test
resource before any customer resource on the node is deployed. Nova and Cinder
has the setting of ‚Äúenable_new_services‚Äù in each conf to disable the initial
service status to achieve this. This proposal adds enable_new_agents config.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I84c1a152c5d0cc120b7076f50079cde1395a206c
Implements: blueprint enable-new-agents
Related-Bug: 1472076

subject: Improve logging for _send_sensor_data failure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-22 15:27:47.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/conductor/manager.py'], 'message': "Improve logging for _send_sensor_data failure

When a node's driver doesn't have management defined, it can't get
sensor data and causes an AttributeError which results in a generic
log message that doesn't describe the actual issue.

Add a check to see if the node's driver has management defined. If not,
log a descriptive warning and skip trying to get and send sensor data
for that node.

Change-Id: Idf7edc16abfad272cd4b35c813690d624320bdd4
Closes-Bug: 1413618
"}]
commit_message:
Improve logging for _send_sensor_data failure

When a node's driver doesn't have management defined, it can't get
sensor data and causes an AttributeError which results in a generic
log message that doesn't describe the actual issue.

Add a check to see if the node's driver has management defined. If not,
log a descriptive warning and skip trying to get and send sensor data
for that node.

Change-Id: Idf7edc16abfad272cd4b35c813690d624320bdd4
Closes-Bug: 1413618

commit_message:

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-22 19:49:16.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/bifrost.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Additional bifrost integration test job

Addition of a non-voting bifrost integration test that exercises
the code path utilized for image builds while building a diskimage-
builder based IPA image, along with a guest image to be booted,
which should draw it's network configuration via simple-init/glean.

This ultimately allows for an integrated test of:
* bifrost
* diskimage-builder
* ironic
* ironic-python-agent

* simple-init/glean

Change-Id: Id9b4888fb20d5af163f14fe1f9136913f95a8a5f
"}]
commit_message:
Additional bifrost integration test job

Addition of a non-voting bifrost integration test that exercises
the code path utilized for image builds while building a diskimage-
builder based IPA image, along with a guest image to be booted,
which should draw it's network configuration via simple-init/glean.

This ultimately allows for an integrated test of:
* bifrost
* diskimage-builder
* ironic
* ironic-python-agent
* python-ironicclient
* shade
* simple-init/glean

Change-Id: Id9b4888fb20d5af163f14fe1f9136913f95a8a5f

commit_message:
Disable python34 jobs for stable glance_store

Change Id977b4e605196bafae593c4c6f59ef55d9d4f384 enabled the python34
gate for all glance_store branches. However, the glance_store stable
branches have never been python34 compatible.

This commit disables it for the stable kilo branch

Change-Id: I6b69d8dbdd8aa0078c790311649295f97c71e198

commit_message:
Ensure policy enforcement level is less equal than 100

This patch adds stricter value examination when doing policy
update to ensure the value of enforcement level is less equal
than 100.

commit_message:
copy_puppet_logs: if possible, copy tempest config

For instance, /tmp/openstack/tempest is the directory where we run tempest.
We want to have access to tempest config after job runs, so let's copy
the file.

Change-Id: I3a38c9ca41706970d4033765833379632eced875

commit_message:
Correct Link to Launch Instances in Dashboard in Cloud Administrator Guide

In the Admin Guide for Cloud, under the Dashboard subcategory, the link
used as a reference to launch instances with the dashboard does not point
to the correct section in the End-User Guide.

This fix will update the current link to point to the correct section in
the End-User Guide.

Change-Id: I0c8db1f4b27286a739d32c444f3b94681b42f637
Closes-Bug: #1489133

commit_message:
Add Wait Condition support to Heat Engine

This spec proposes to add support of Wait Condition resource to Sahara
Heat engine.
Heat supports Wait Condition for reporting signals.
We use Wait Condition for getting status of VM.

Change-Id: I5f781f87061a472dad2563b81800b8272c64d633
bp: sahara-heat-wait-conditions

commit_message:
Rename existing service-* to coe-service-*

At present, all 'magnum service-*' CLIs are specific to Kubernetes.
As a community, we anticipate that other COEs may introduce 'service'
concept too, going forward. Thus, moving 'service-*' CLIs to be
'coe-service-*', instead of 'k8s-service-*'.
This is also required to model 'magnum service-list' after 'nova
service-list'[blueprint].

Change-Id: Ia4ee95e324087309b7f771b3a9d4930b8d8589cf
Partially-Implements: blueprint magnum-service-list
Closes-bug: #1487580

commit_message:
Add WinRM helper

This patch set adds a WinRM helper, which will be used for managing
Windows Service Instances.

This will make use of the pywinrm library. Password as well as
certificate based authentication will be available.

Co-Authored-By: Alin Balutoiu <abalutoiu@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Change-Id: I6f0ca85c7e4ed35301fff4714e65d54f1fcc29a6
Partially-implements: blueprint windows-smb-support

commit_message:
Add tenant_id validation in RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP

In the current code, there is no validation for tenant_id passed in, or use
type string to do the validation. The patch updates it with type uuid
validation.

Change-Id: I14744d8231e41fecc3498ecebdca25719a3414af
Closes-Bug: #1480859

subject: Adding support for Keystone V3
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-08-26 17:20:40.000000000', 'files': ['rally-jobs/plugins/cue_utils.py', 'tests/integration/common/config.py', 'tests/integration/cue-integration.conf', 'contrib/devstack/extras.d/80-cue-rally-config.sh', 'doc/source/configuration.rst', 'contrib/devstack/local.conf', 'tests/integration/common/client.py', 'doc/source/examples/example-cue.conf'], 'message': 'Adding support for Keystone V3

Tempest client will now check which Keystone version is specified in
the conf and make the appropriate call to either v2 or v3. Rally
tests using v3. Adding a new extras.d file so devstack will set
up the Rally config to point to Keystone v3 without altering the
actual devstack config. Adding documentation for Keystone v3 specific
args.

Change-Id: Iae8ffb412c00b7ca0e02ff0e6f4374eaae64005d
'}]
commit_message:
Adding support for Keystone V3

Tempest client will now check which Keystone version is specified in
the conf and make the appropriate call to either v2 or v3. Rally
tests using v3. Adding a new extras.d file so devstack will set
up the Rally config to point to Keystone v3 without altering the
actual devstack config. Adding documentation for Keystone v3 specific
args.

Change-Id: Iae8ffb412c00b7ca0e02ff0e6f4374eaae64005d

subject: Prevent exception for invalidly encoded parameters
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-08-18 17:22:38.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_wsgi.py', 'keystone/common/wsgi.py'], 'message': "Prevent exception for invalidly encoded parameters

An exception occurs in the WebOb library when it tries to decode a
parameter that is not valid UTF8. To avoid this let's wrap the section
using the WebOb code and raise a ValidationError so the user gets
proper feedback instead of a UnknownError and a server 500 response.

Change-Id: I6781770a6c5b317eaef84064ef61b9c838d22bc2
Closes-Bug: 1485694
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent exception for invalidly encoded parameters

An exception occurs in the WebOb library when it tries to decode a
parameter that is not valid UTF8. To avoid this let's wrap the section
using the WebOb code and raise a ValidationError so the user gets
proper feedback instead of a UnknownError and a server 500 response.

Change-Id: I6781770a6c5b317eaef84064ef61b9c838d22bc2
Closes-Bug: 1485694

commit_message:
Fix description for "Inapt spelling of 'MongoDB'"

There is an inapt spelling in the file called
ceilometer/doc/source/webapi/v2.rst.
  line194:...different meaning in Mongo DB and...
  line198:...the Mongo DB will return every....
  line199:See more in the Mongod DB doc.
I think "Mongo DB" and "Mongod DB" are supposed to
spelled as "MongoDB".

Change-Id: Icb72e5e5eb099a839c4ef5aba292a42976144428
Closes-Bug: #1488775

commit_message:
Fix scenario test fails when port_vnic_type is set

The commit 0a03b7a37a20c206932206eea8602d9f4b009ae9 broke a working external CI
which tests SRIOV. This is a fix for this.

The main issue is that TestNetworkAdvancedServerOps object doesn't have
network attribute while TestNetworkBasicOps has. This patch set a common
attribute ports for all of them because ports are only created in
create_server method of manager.py when port_vnic_type is set.

Change-Id: Ib6c3081638bde05e56a40b70e2dda9677b43e04e

commit_message:
Make volumes_extensions_client use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.
This patch makes volumes_extensions_client use **kwargs.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Ie7f61741d54a629a15b1e2b8fce178ebc06176d3

commit_message:
Cleanup for merging v2 and v2.1 functional tests.

All functional tests have been merged between v2 and v2.1.
This commit does the cleanup for all TODO added while merging the tests.

Partially implements blueprint test-collapse-v2-and-v21

commit_message:
Ability to specify keystone v3 in nova.conf for neutron

As part of moving components to use keystone v3, this review
allows nova.conf's [neutron] section to switch to using the
auth_plugin in keystoneclient for talking to keystone /v3 API

Change-Id: I42502bff147534199096fb581630b8559f311963

commit_message:
Move in-tree vendor AGENT_TYPE_* constants

AGENT_TYPE_* constants[1] define all agent types BUT vendor ones are only
used by in-tree vendor code. This changes moves in-tree AGENT_TYPE_*
constants[2] to vendor modules to ensure they will be removed from neutron
code on decomposition.

[1] in neutron.common.constants
[2] AGENT_TYPE_HYPERV/MLNX/SDNVE

Change-Id: Id03fb147e11541be309c1cd22ce27e70fadc28b5
Partial-Bug: #1487598

commit_message:
Move in-tree vendor VIF_TYPE_* constants

VIF_TYPE_* constants[1] defines all vif types BUT vendor ones are only
used by in-tree/out-of-tree vendor code. This changes moves in-tree
VIF_TYPE_* constants[2] to vendor modules to ensure they will be removed
from neutron code on decomposition.

[1] in neutron.extensions.portbindings
[2] VIF_TYPE_HYPERV/IB_HOSTDEV/HW_WEB/VROUTER

Change-Id: Iee73426221d693689ba24d2ce2660bb7351f02fc
Partial-Bug: #1486279

commit_message:
Remove VIF_TYPES constant

VIF_TYPES[1] lists all vif types including out-of-tree ones BUT was only
used by out-of-tree bigswitch code: dependent change defined VIF_TYPES
in bigswitch repo in order to allow VIF_TYPES removal from neutron code.

[1] in neutron.extensions.portbindings

Closes-Bug: #1486277
Related-Bug: #1486279
Depends-On: I79d0af975bb62a2ccea87eda5cf43f3f064b5078
Change-Id: I39fc344361c21332b947f21f157d4f2a27caad47

commit_message:
unify REST word

Representational State Transfer, by official definition the abbreviation
should be *REST* not *ReST*. We should make it unified.

Change-Id: Ia1e5c5145ab0db22fd9ff1393bf507648a31112b

commit_message:
Add IPv6 Prefix Delegation compatibility to ipam_pluggable_backend

This patch makes the necessary changes for IPv6 PD to function when
pluggable ipam is enabled with the reference driver.

Includes a unit test for this functionality.

Change-Id: I4227cc08fdd62922632629c424dbeb542a48a67f
Partially-Implements: blueprint ipv6-prefix-delegation

commit_message:
Add portType on port option

According to http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.config/cfg.html
oslo.config can use portType to support the ability to set valid range
on port option values

Change-Id: Id7030177e0369873d374a8615545dbcb9b5dd4e1

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-08-12 18:24:20.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/token/provider.py', 'keystone/token/providers/common.py'], 'message': 'When validating a V3 token as V2, use the v3_to_v2 conversion

There is no need to use the V2 token formatter, which is a separate
code path from the v3_to_v2_token code (needed for Fernet tokens).
This patchset aligns the v2 token validation when the original token
is V3 to work with the v3_to_v2_token converter.

Change-Id: Ia88c560e89abdd937376c5c38770298ab9adcef5
'}]
commit_message:
When validating a V3 token as V2, use the v3_to_v2 conversion

There is no need to use the V2 token formatter, which is a separate
code path from the v3_to_v2_token code (needed for Fernet tokens).
This patchset aligns the v2 token validation when the original token
is V3 to work with the v3_to_v2_token converter.

Change-Id: Ia88c560e89abdd937376c5c38770298ab9adcef5

commit_message:
Add availability zones support

Rework availability zones support which was inherited from Cinder:
- Add public API extension
- Preserve AZ if creating a share from a snapshot
- Always set AZ in Share API or Share Manager
- Update db schema and create db migration
- Update appropriate unit tests

APIImpact
Partially-Implements: blueprint availability-zones

Change-Id: Iea9fbc3fea5c0128772115c028989121f397e0c5

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-16 08:31:11.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/security_group/neutron_driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_neutron_security_groups.py'], 'message': "neutron - race conditions in security-group additions

When attempting to connect multiple security groups to a single server
concurrently, some of the security groups may not actually get connected
despite the call returning successfully and with no error.

How it happen:
When nova-api want to add/remove security-group, it will send neutron
list-port request. It will response server's ports and their security
group. When two request coming and they send list-port api at same
time. They will receive empty security-group and append
security-group-id. Finally send update_port with security-group array
to neutron. Then last update will override previous update. Therefore
you will sometimes saw one of two secgroup or all of them.

Other scenario:
When you send add new secgroup and remove exist secgroup in same
time. It would probably cause those secgroup are all exist.

Add utils.synchronized to add_to_instance and remove_from_instance

Change-Id: I5dc647ef707ff04ad1cf7e788268cafb89f8ef03
Closes-Bug: 1417975
"}]
commit_message:
neutron - race conditions in security-group additions

When attempting to connect multiple security groups to a single server
concurrently, some of the security groups may not actually get connected
despite the call returning successfully and with no error.

How it happen:
When nova-api want to add/remove security-group, it will send neutron
list-port request. It will response server's ports and their security
group. When two request coming and they send list-port api at same
time. They will receive empty security-group and append
security-group-id. Finally send update_port with security-group array
to neutron. Then last update will override previous update. Therefore
you will sometimes saw one of two secgroup or all of them.

Other scenario:
When you send add new secgroup and remove exist secgroup in same
time. It would probably cause those secgroup are all exist.

Add utils.synchronized to add_to_instance and remove_from_instance

Change-Id: I5dc647ef707ff04ad1cf7e788268cafb89f8ef03
Closes-Bug: 1417975

commit_message:
Add configurable ssh_delay

This patch adds a configurable delay time for retrying the
ssh connection when waiting for the containers to restart.

This is useful for environments where resources are constrained
and containers may take longer to restart.

Change-Id: I0383e34a273b93e1b2651460c853cf1ceba89029
Closes-Bug: #1476885
(cherry picked from commit 57c5f2c77e95b1cc4277ca36c72d3627f38555ab)

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-08-25 19:53:16.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/install/manual.rst', 'doc/source/image_builders/windows.rst', 'doc/source/install/configure_network.rst', 'doc/source/articles/test_docs.rst', 'doc/source/image_builders/linux.rst', 'doc/source/install/prepare.rst', 'doc/source/draft/admin-guide/prepare_lab.rst', 'contrib/devstack/README.rst', 'doc/source/draft/admin-guide/use_cli.rst', 'doc/source/draft/appendix/cli_ref.rst', 'doc/source/guidelines.rst', 'doc/source/image_builders/upload.rst'], 'message': "Make commands in install manual copy-paste-able

Before commands in manual.rst and related files started with $ sign.
While this shows, that commands should be executed in shell it also
makes them hard to copy-paste.

This change removes $ and splits commands, that include ';' into
multiple lines. After this change user would be able to copy-paste whole
blocks of code into shell and execute them right away.

Removes `#` that meant that root privileges are required for the

Fixes occasional indentation inconsistencies.

Change-Id: Ib649ae2a3a110bdf09b0bf9c5fbf54a5ce40ccc6
"}]
commit_message:
Make commands in install manual copy-paste-able

Before commands in manual.rst and related files started with $ sign.
While this shows, that commands should be executed in shell it also
makes them hard to copy-paste.

This change removes $ and splits commands, that include ';' into
multiple lines. After this change user would be able to copy-paste whole
blocks of code into shell and execute them right away.

Removes `#` that meant that root privileges are required for the
command and adds sudo, where relevant (yum/apt, etc.).
Fixes occasional indentation inconsistencies.

Change-Id: Ib649ae2a3a110bdf09b0bf9c5fbf54a5ce40ccc6

subject: Enforced AUTO replacement_policy for sharedIp port
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-26 15:26:51.000000000', 'files': ['meta/io.murano/Classes/SharedIp.yaml'], 'message': 'Enforced AUTO replacement_policy for sharedIp port

In Openstack releases prior to Kilo Heat recreates all the Neutron Ports
during the stack update regardless of the port resource being actually
updated or not. This is done intentionally to workaround the bug in nova
(https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1158684)
However, this approach may cause issues when the stack is updated after
the instance and the port are created (which happens during many Murano
env deployments). To control port re-creation logic Heat allows to
explicitly specify the replacement_policy property for OS::Neutron::Port
resource: if set to AUTO it forbids Heat to recreate the port if it was
not modified.

For regular instances and their ports we are already using this setting.
However, for the ports created for SharedIps this was not true, thus
causing issues on pre-kilo deployments. This patch fixes it.

On deployments using Kilo+ Heat this patch has no effect, as the default
value of replacenent_policy is already AUTO in this releases.

Change-Id: Ib87961a4f2285bf622df50828ecd2ad98365a910
Closes-Bug: #1488105
'}]
commit_message:
Enforced AUTO replacement_policy for sharedIp port

In Openstack releases prior to Kilo Heat recreates all the Neutron Ports
during the stack update regardless of the port resource being actually
updated or not. This is done intentionally to workaround the bug in nova
(https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1158684)
However, this approach may cause issues when the stack is updated after
the instance and the port are created (which happens during many Murano
env deployments). To control port re-creation logic Heat allows to
explicitly specify the replacement_policy property for OS::Neutron::Port
resource: if set to AUTO it forbids Heat to recreate the port if it was
not modified.

For regular instances and their ports we are already using this setting.
However, for the ports created for SharedIps this was not true, thus
causing issues on pre-kilo deployments. This patch fixes it.

On deployments using Kilo+ Heat this patch has no effect, as the default
value of replacenent_policy is already AUTO in this releases.

Change-Id: Ib87961a4f2285bf622df50828ecd2ad98365a910
Closes-Bug: #1488105

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-25 08:34:52.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/tests/initiator/test_connector.py', 'os_brick/initiator/connector.py'], 'message': 'Handle FC LUN IDs greater 255 correctly on s390x architectures

FC LUN IDs betfeen 100 hex and ffff hex need to be formatted correctly
for the unit_add command. Otherwise, the volume will not be added to the
hypervisor configuration and the hypervisor will not be able to perform
I/O to it.

Closes-Bug: #1488233

Change-Id: Iaa0ead59132d6baf8bcb9e3dd95d4839c26e93ea
'}]
commit_message:
Handle FC LUN IDs greater 255 correctly on s390x architectures

FC LUN IDs betfeen 100 hex and ffff hex need to be formatted correctly
for the unit_add command. Otherwise, the volume will not be added to the
hypervisor configuration and the hypervisor will not be able to perform
I/O to it.

Closes-Bug: #1488233

Change-Id: Iaa0ead59132d6baf8bcb9e3dd95d4839c26e93ea

commit_message:
Add firstboot example for os-collect-config overrides

Currently heat provides all of the os-collect-config metadata, which
is consumed via the "heat_local" collector, but in some cases we may
want to provide additional config on boot, such that config not provided
by heat may be influenced.  This example shows how one way of doing this
by setting up a local file for the "local" os-collect-config collector.

This can be enabled in the resource_registry, e.g:

Change-Id: I885589b0e09d1dff0444abf8925e247b81083857
OS::TripleO::NodeUserData: firstboot/userdata_occ_params.yaml

commit_message:
Fix pylint warnings

Fixes some of the more interesting pylint warning
messages. Most changes were for things that were
potentially dangerous, though there are a couple
that could cause unexpected behavior.

This does not address all pylint warnings. There
are still many that are not legitimate concerns,
though they could be reviewed for other possible
problems not caught by this patch.

Change-Id: I5decd705ef7ace482fb2632172ae43eec04f8911

Add nested-validation spec

large trees of nested templates.

commit_message:
Update nose-exclude to 0.4.0

The version 0.3.0 contains a bug which blocks running unit tests on
Horizon with Python 3. The bug causes *all* tests to be excluded.

The bug:

- https://bitbucket.org/kgrandis/nose-exclude/issues/10/test-failures-with-python-3
- https://github.com/kgrandis/nose-exclude/issues/3

Change-Id: Iddd583b1dec0423057dbafc5e4d79215c65642b0

commit_message:
Network template added to HTTP PUT response

Fuel client expects, that network template body will
be returned as JSON in response on PUT request to url
/clusters/(?P<cluster_id>\d+)/network_configuration/template/

Change-Id: If53a028d2face9f16d1a4617790fea32ad82ae97
Closes-Bug: #1488923

subject: Move & refactor atomic actions
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-25 20:58:42.000000000', 'files': ['rally/task/atomic.py', 'tests/unit/task/test_scenario.py', 'rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/tempest/utils.py', 'rally/task/scenario.py', 'tests/unit/task/test_atomic.py'], 'message': 'Move & refactor atomic actions

* Move atomic actions from rally.task.scenario to
  newly created rally.task.atomic

* Introduce atomic.ActionTimerMixin which should be
  used as a base for class that support atomic actions

* Simplify atomic.ActionTimer code (it was over designed)

* Unify atomic actions mechanism so it will be possible
  to use in other places (e.g. context)

Change-Id: I5702224a5cba4672c0c2f80f00b67aade19dc29c
'}]
commit_message:
Move & refactor atomic actions

* Move atomic actions from rally.task.scenario to
  newly created rally.task.atomic

* Introduce atomic.ActionTimerMixin which should be
  used as a base for class that support atomic actions

* Simplify atomic.ActionTimer code (it was over designed)

* Unify atomic actions mechanism so it will be possible
  to use in other places (e.g. context)

Change-Id: I5702224a5cba4672c0c2f80f00b67aade19dc29c

subject: copy_puppet_logs: get more informations
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-26 03:37:05.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/copy_puppet_logs.sh'], 'message': "copy_puppet_logs: get more informations

* to know RAM status, use 'free -m' and create free.txt
* to know CPU informations, use 'cat /proc/cpuinfo' and create
  cpuinfo

This will be useful when debugging VMs running OpenStack, and eventually
detect services that consume too much CPU & RAM during Puppet OpenStack
jobs.

Change-Id: I033e8d42b430ee002e6ec3c3a589b23739b5b57c
"}]
commit_message:
copy_puppet_logs: get more informations

* to know RAM status, use 'free -m' and create free.txt
* to know CPU informations, use 'cat /proc/cpuinfo' and create
  cpuinfo

This will be useful when debugging VMs running OpenStack, and eventually
detect services that consume too much CPU & RAM during Puppet OpenStack
jobs.

Change-Id: I033e8d42b430ee002e6ec3c3a589b23739b5b57c

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-27 16:21:05.000000000', 'files': ['tools/abandon_old_reviews.sh'], 'message': 'Add abandon script to clean up orphaned reviews

Some one-off private scripts have been used in the past to
clean up reviews with no activity. This attempts to add an
official script for this to the repo in the tools directory.

Script will skip any patches with Workflow=-1 to not touch
any WIP patches.

Change-Id: Ie258833d3c34758f2e78deaee3d44f1623dee8e6
'}]
commit_message:
Add abandon script to clean up orphaned reviews

Some one-off private scripts have been used in the past to
clean up reviews with no activity. This attempts to add an
official script for this to the repo in the tools directory.

Script will skip any patches with Workflow=-1 to not touch
any WIP patches.

Change-Id: Ie258833d3c34758f2e78deaee3d44f1623dee8e6

subject: Iterate over copy of session.adapters keys in Python2/3
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-12 13:28:00.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/session.py'], 'message': "Iterate over copy of session.adapters keys in Python2/3

Iterate over a copy of session.adapters keys in both Python 2.x and
Python 3.x.  In Python 3.x, keys() is not a copy, and therefore
items can't be popped from it while iterating.

Change-Id: I4c7ac6e9f69eb409aa991f97ebde6f1581cd27b7
Closes-Bug: #1483872
"}]
commit_message:
Iterate over copy of session.adapters keys in Python2/3

Iterate over a copy of session.adapters keys in both Python 2.x and
Python 3.x.  In Python 3.x, keys() is not a copy, and therefore
items can't be popped from it while iterating.

Change-Id: I4c7ac6e9f69eb409aa991f97ebde6f1581cd27b7
Closes-Bug: #1483872

commit_message:
Create a versions.py file

Create constants for the versions and put them into versions.py.  Use
these constants instead of unnamed numerical constants.

In the future, versions.py, could possibly contain more than constants.
Possibly helper functions related to versioning could be placed in it.

Change-Id: I8c68133e68d77ac451506b3a5bae038b641ed31f

commit_message:
Add dns_label processing for Ports

Functionallity is added to enable users to specify a dns_label field during
port creation and update. This dns_label field will be used for DNS resolution
of the hostname in dnsmasq and also will be used when Neutron can integrate
with external DNS systems.

APIImpact

commit_message:
Fixed alignment issues in create firewall

In create firewall form, add router tab has
alignment issue between the router list and helptext.

Similarly in create policy form, add rule tab has same
alignment issue.

This patch fixing both the alignment issues.

Change-Id: I88d456f917fa000e81214330e150c39bce4a8cc9
Closes-Bug: #1481697

commit_message:
Pin puppetlabs-mongodb to a working version

There was a regression in the upstream puppetlabs-mongodb
module causing rs.initiate to fail. This ultimately causes
the Mongodb_replset resources to fail in our puppet modules.

Change-Id: Ifa37498d07c6c2ee79055a82cd764f6b583d6a05
Related-bug: #1488531

commit_message:
Support QoS neutron-client (1/2).

This patch adds the command line support for
1. QoS policy
2. QoS policy association with the neutron network
3. QoS policy association with the neutron port

Note: Neutronclient support for QoS rule-types will be addressed via a separate patch
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/198277/)

DocImpact
APIImpact

Partially-Implements: blueprint quantum-qos-api
Co-Authored-By: Ramanjaneya Reddy Palleti <ramanjieee@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: John Schwarz <jschwarz@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: vikram.choudhary <vikram.choudhary@huawei.com>
Change-Id: If7460516a3b3e3ccb91f2e7becfe7335ff809bda

subject: Disallow unsafe tempurl operations to point to unauthorized data
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-26 15:01:28.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/tempurl.py', 'test/functional/tests.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_tempurl.py'], 'message': 'Disallow unsafe tempurl operations to point to unauthorized data

Do not allow PUT tempurls to create pointers to other data. Specifically
disallow the creation of DLO object manifests by returning an error if a
non-safe tempurl request includes an X-Object-Manifest header regardless of
the value of the header.

This prevents discoverability attacks which can use any PUT tempurl to probe
for private data by creating a DLO object manifest and then using the PUT
tempurl to head the object which would 404 if the prefix does not match any
object data or form a valid DLO HEAD response if it does.

This also prevents a tricky and potentially unexpected consequence of PUT
tempurls which would make it unsafe to allow a user to download objects
created by tempurl (even if they just created them) because the result of
reading the object created via tempurl may not be the data which was uploaded.

Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>

Change-Id: I91161dfb0f089c3990aca1b4255b520299ef73c8
'}]
commit_message:
Disallow unsafe tempurl operations to point to unauthorized data

Do not allow PUT tempurls to create pointers to other data. Specifically
disallow the creation of DLO object manifests by returning an error if a
non-safe tempurl request includes an X-Object-Manifest header regardless of
the value of the header.

This prevents discoverability attacks which can use any PUT tempurl to probe
for private data by creating a DLO object manifest and then using the PUT
tempurl to head the object which would 404 if the prefix does not match any
object data or form a valid DLO HEAD response if it does.

This also prevents a tricky and potentially unexpected consequence of PUT
tempurls which would make it unsafe to allow a user to download objects
created by tempurl (even if they just created them) because the result of
reading the object created via tempurl may not be the data which was uploaded.

Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>

Change-Id: I91161dfb0f089c3990aca1b4255b520299ef73c8

commit_message:
Enable admin level on the haproxy stats socket

This makes possible to use:

`hatop -s /var/run/haproxy.stat`

with F9/F10 buttons to enable/disable backends.

Closes-Bug: #1487378
Change-Id: I6711cc7aa31701466e5a624589588b1b53e24f02
(cherry picked from commit 84a325bd65eaf6d1ea02ed380d0b9741ae07fac9)

subject: Trigger restart after adding user to cephkeys
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-24 16:15:20.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/ceph_client/tasks/ceph_auth.yml'], 'message': 'Trigger restart after adding user to cephkeys

Currently, on an AIO, when you deploy w/ ceph support nova-compute
comes up non-functional and needs a restart.  Doing an strace on the
nova-compute process, you can see nova-compute is unable to read the
/etc/ceph/ceph.client.cinder.keyring file.  This reason for this is due
to the fact that cinder-volume and nova-compute both live on the same
host, and a bulk of the tasks in ceph_auth.yml (which do have valid
restarts) are being taken care of when the cinder installation playbook
is run.  When the nova installation playbook is run, ceph_auth.yml is
included after nova is installed but when nova is added to cephkeys
there is nothing else happening in that task file to trigger a restart
of nova.

Change-Id: I61e2709ce48ff80fd6eded9c1e6bd649bcd73088
Closes-Bug: #1486504
(cherry picked from commit 51757afe1625f6ed74b3bae56f9864c0ea0f6ec8)
'}]
commit_message:
Trigger restart after adding user to cephkeys

Currently, on an AIO, when you deploy w/ ceph support nova-compute
comes up non-functional and needs a restart.  Doing an strace on the
nova-compute process, you can see nova-compute is unable to read the
/etc/ceph/ceph.client.cinder.keyring file.  This reason for this is due
to the fact that cinder-volume and nova-compute both live on the same
host, and a bulk of the tasks in ceph_auth.yml (which do have valid
restarts) are being taken care of when the cinder installation playbook
is run.  When the nova installation playbook is run, ceph_auth.yml is
included after nova is installed but when nova is added to cephkeys
there is nothing else happening in that task file to trigger a restart
of nova.

Change-Id: I61e2709ce48ff80fd6eded9c1e6bd649bcd73088
Closes-Bug: #1486504
(cherry picked from commit 51757afe1625f6ed74b3bae56f9864c0ea0f6ec8)

commit_message:
Add service group as a firewall customized service

This patch introduces the model and extension framework
for implementing service group.
Two resources service_group and service_object are added,
modules can refer multiple service groups to allow the
user flexibilty to define their own groups and use them without impacting
the other users.
Each service object can be defined with a timeout value that can be used
to overwrite default session idle timeout value.
More info can be found at service group wiki
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Neutron/FWaaS/FWaaS-ServiceGroup
Implements: blueprint fwaas-customized-service for customized service

Change-Id: Id33287cb87860608e8e81f243b41214c7b5805e4
Authored-by: badveli vishnuvardhan <badveli_vishnuus@yahoo.com>
Scenario-Test:https://review.openstack.org/#/c/200753/
Tempest-Test:https://review.openstack.org/#/c/113409/

commit_message:
Fixes for WSME updates

WSME released version 0.8.0 which included a few API breaking changes.
These changes resulted in additional validation of our API definition and
is a good thing as things that should have been caught in testing are being caught now.

Email thread:
http://osdir.com/ml/openstack-dev/2015-08/msg01687.html

Culprit:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/182761/7

Change-Id: I782545d135d622ce8238ec71695ebc342e68bcf7

commit_message:
Force use of Accounts for test purposes

Do not merge!

Force switch allow_tenant_isolation off to test the Accounts
implementation. If the YAML file is not there, the test accounts
must be generated on the fly, so reusing tenant isolation for that.

This does not test the read of YAML file bit, but it should test
everything else.

Change-Id: I5f62204d268de856a95188ec21105d483a5f76d2

subject: Better scoping for tempurls, especially container tempurls
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-26 15:01:28.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/tempurl.py', 'test/functional/tests.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_tempurl.py', 'swift/proxy/server.py'], 'message': 'Better scoping for tempurls, especially container tempurls

It used to be that a GET of a tempurl referencing a large object would
let you download that large object regardless of where its segments
lived. However, this led to some violated user expectations around
container tempurls.

(Note on shorthand: all tempurls reference objects. However, "account
tempurl" and "container tempurl" are shorthand meaning tempurls
generated using a key on the account or container, respectively.)

Let's say an application is given tempurl keys to a particular
container, and it does all its work therein using those keys. The user
expects that, if the application is compromised, then the attacker
only gains access to the "compromised-container". However, with the old
behavior, the attacker could read data from *any* container like so:

1) Choose a "victim-container" to download

2) Create PUT and GET tempurl for any object name within the
   "compromised-container". The object doesn't need to exist;
   we'll create it.

3) Using the PUT tempurl, upload a DLO manifest with
   "X-Object-Manifest: /victim-container/"

4) Using the GET tempurl, download the object created in step 3. The
   result will be the concatenation of all objects in the
   "victim-container".

Step 3 need not be for all objects in the "victim-container"; for
example, a value "X-Object-Manifest: /victim-container/abc" would only
be the concatenation of all objects whose names begin with "abc". By
probing for object names in this way, individual objects may be found
and extracted.

A similar bug would exist for manifests referencing other accounts
except that neither the X-Object-Manifest (DLO) nor the JSON manifest
document (SLO) have a way of specifying a different account.

This change makes it so that a container tempurl only grants access to
objects within its container, *including* large-object segments. This
breaks backward compatibility for container tempurls that may have
pointed to cross container *LO's, but (a) there are security
implications, and (b) container tempurls are a relatively new feature.

This works by having the tempurl middleware install an authorization
callback ('swift.authorize' in the WSGI environment) that limits the
scope of any requests to the account or container from which the key
came.

This requires swift.authorize to persist for both the manifest request
and all segment requests; this is done by having the proxy server
restore it to the WSGI environment prior to returning from __call__.

Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clayg@swiftstack.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Christian Schwede <cschwede@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Matthew Oliver <matt@oliver.net.au>

Change-Id: I11078af178cb9acdd9039388282fcd0db165ba7a
'}]
commit_message:
Better scoping for tempurls, especially container tempurls

It used to be that a GET of a tempurl referencing a large object would
let you download that large object regardless of where its segments
lived. However, this led to some violated user expectations around
container tempurls.

(Note on shorthand: all tempurls reference objects. However, "account
tempurl" and "container tempurl" are shorthand meaning tempurls
generated using a key on the account or container, respectively.)

Let's say an application is given tempurl keys to a particular
container, and it does all its work therein using those keys. The user
expects that, if the application is compromised, then the attacker
only gains access to the "compromised-container". However, with the old
behavior, the attacker could read data from *any* container like so:

1) Choose a "victim-container" to download

2) Create PUT and GET tempurl for any object name within the
   "compromised-container". The object doesn't need to exist;
   we'll create it.

3) Using the PUT tempurl, upload a DLO manifest with
   "X-Object-Manifest: /victim-container/"

4) Using the GET tempurl, download the object created in step 3. The
   result will be the concatenation of all objects in the
   "victim-container".

Step 3 need not be for all objects in the "victim-container"; for
example, a value "X-Object-Manifest: /victim-container/abc" would only
be the concatenation of all objects whose names begin with "abc". By
probing for object names in this way, individual objects may be found
and extracted.

A similar bug would exist for manifests referencing other accounts
except that neither the X-Object-Manifest (DLO) nor the JSON manifest
document (SLO) have a way of specifying a different account.

This change makes it so that a container tempurl only grants access to
objects within its container, *including* large-object segments. This
breaks backward compatibility for container tempurls that may have
pointed to cross container *LO's, but (a) there are security
implications, and (b) container tempurls are a relatively new feature.

This works by having the tempurl middleware install an authorization
callback ('swift.authorize' in the WSGI environment) that limits the
scope of any requests to the account or container from which the key
came.

This requires swift.authorize to persist for both the manifest request
and all segment requests; this is done by having the proxy server
restore it to the WSGI environment prior to returning from __call__.

Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clayg@swiftstack.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Christian Schwede <cschwede@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Matthew Oliver <matt@oliver.net.au>

Change-Id: I11078af178cb9acdd9039388282fcd0db165ba7a

commit_message:
Set iptables-persistent install execution to append to log

This patch sets the command to install the iptables-persistent
package in the run-playbooks script to append its output to the
existing log instead of overwriting it.

This is to ensure that outputs from both commands are captured,
not just the second one.

Change-Id: I4d45382cb44c5f811818fe1229a63e6a2c2ecdee
Partial-Bug: #1485917
(cherry picked from commit a515e835bb5aef9cf4757ef3ac79f61ae560296a)

subject: Remove custom SSL compression handling
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-08-26 12:28:01.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/tests/functional/test_readonly_glance.py', 'glanceclient/tests/unit/test_ssl.py', 'requirements.txt', 'glanceclient/shell.py', 'glanceclient/tests/unit/test_http.py', 'glanceclient/common/http.py', 'glanceclient/common/utils.py'], 'message': "Remove custom SSL compression handling

Custom SSL handling was introduced because disabling SSL layer compression
provided an approximately five fold performance increase in some
cases. Without SSL layer compression disabled the image transfer would be
CPU bound -- with the CPU performing the DEFLATE algorithm.  This would
typically limit image transfers to < 20 MB/s. When --no-ssl-compression
was specified the client would not negotiate any compression algorithm
during the SSL handshake with the server which would remove the CPU
bottleneck and transfers could approach wire speed.

In order to support '--no-ssl-compression' two totally separate code
paths exist depending on whether this is True or False.  When SSL
compression is disabled, rather than using the standard 'requests'
library, we enter some custom code based on pyopenssl and httplib in
order to disable compression.

This patch/spec proposes removing the custom code because:

* It is a burden to maintain

 Eg adding new code such as keystone session support is more complicated

* It can introduce additional failure modes

 We have seen some bugs related to the 'custom' certificate checking

* Newer Operating Systems disable SSL for us.

 Eg. While Debian 7 defaulted to compression 'on', Debian 8 has compression
 'off'. This makes both servers and client less likely to have compression
 enabled.

* Newer combinations of 'requests' and 'python' do this for us

 Requests disables compression when backed by a version of python which
 supports it (>= 2.7.9). This makes clients more likely to disable
 compression out-of-the-box.

* It is (in principle) possible to do this on older versions too

 If pyopenssl, ndg-httpsclient and pyasn1 are installed on older
 operating system/python combinations, the requests library should
 disable SSL compression on the client side.

* Systems that have SSL compression enabled may be vulnerable to the CRIME
(https://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2012-4929) attack.
Installations which are security conscious should be running the Glance
server with SSL disabled.

Full Spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/187674
Blueprint: remove-custom-client-ssl-handling

Change-Id: I7e7761fc91b0d6da03939374eeedd809534f6edf
"}]
commit_message:
Remove custom SSL compression handling

Custom SSL handling was introduced because disabling SSL layer compression
provided an approximately five fold performance increase in some
cases. Without SSL layer compression disabled the image transfer would be
CPU bound -- with the CPU performing the DEFLATE algorithm.  This would
typically limit image transfers to < 20 MB/s. When --no-ssl-compression
was specified the client would not negotiate any compression algorithm
during the SSL handshake with the server which would remove the CPU
bottleneck and transfers could approach wire speed.

In order to support '--no-ssl-compression' two totally separate code
paths exist depending on whether this is True or False.  When SSL
compression is disabled, rather than using the standard 'requests'
library, we enter some custom code based on pyopenssl and httplib in
order to disable compression.

This patch/spec proposes removing the custom code because:

* It is a burden to maintain

 Eg adding new code such as keystone session support is more complicated

* It can introduce additional failure modes

 We have seen some bugs related to the 'custom' certificate checking

* Newer Operating Systems disable SSL for us.

 Eg. While Debian 7 defaulted to compression 'on', Debian 8 has compression
 'off'. This makes both servers and client less likely to have compression
 enabled.

* Newer combinations of 'requests' and 'python' do this for us

 Requests disables compression when backed by a version of python which
 supports it (>= 2.7.9). This makes clients more likely to disable
 compression out-of-the-box.

* It is (in principle) possible to do this on older versions too

 If pyopenssl, ndg-httpsclient and pyasn1 are installed on older
 operating system/python combinations, the requests library should
 disable SSL compression on the client side.

* Systems that have SSL compression enabled may be vulnerable to the CRIME
(https://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2012-4929) attack.
Installations which are security conscious should be running the Glance
server with SSL disabled.

Full Spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/187674
Blueprint: remove-custom-client-ssl-handling

Change-Id: I7e7761fc91b0d6da03939374eeedd809534f6edf

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-08-26 05:35:32.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_replicationcontroller.py', 'magnum/api/controllers/v1/x509keypair.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_x509keypair.py', 'magnum/api/controllers/v1/bay.py', 'magnum/api/controllers/v1/replicationcontroller.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_pod.py', 'magnum/api/controllers/v1/container.py', 'magnum/api/controllers/v1/baymodel.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_bay.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_node.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_service.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_container.py', 'magnum/api/controllers/v1/node.py', 'magnum/api/controllers/v1/pod.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_baymodel.py', 'magnum/api/controllers/v1/service.py'], 'message': 'Set project_id and user_id from context directly

Currently project_id and user_id are retrieved from auth_token_info,
but these parameters can be retrieved from v3 keystone api only.
Because auth_token_info is different between v2 and v3. If keystone
version v2 is specified in the config file, magnum will not work.

This patch uses "context.project_id" instead of
auth_token_info['token']['project']['id'].
Because auth_token_info['token'] is set by only keystone v3.

Change-Id: I6982f38934c0778d9a0c4271dbe08f0758b671ad
Closes-Bug: #1487992
'}]
commit_message:
Set project_id and user_id from context directly

Currently project_id and user_id are retrieved from auth_token_info,
but these parameters can be retrieved from v3 keystone api only.
Because auth_token_info is different between v2 and v3. If keystone
version v2 is specified in the config file, magnum will not work.

This patch uses "context.project_id" instead of
auth_token_info['token']['project']['id'].
Because auth_token_info['token'] is set by only keystone v3.

Change-Id: I6982f38934c0778d9a0c4271dbe08f0758b671ad
Closes-Bug: #1487992

commit_message:
Add net settings check after slaves restart

In tests for bonding feature add additional steps
after environment deployment:

  9. Save network configuration from slave nodes
 10. Reboot all environment nodes
 11. Verify that network configuration is the same
     after reboot

Also fix error with incorrect network assignment to
bonded interfaces (use 'private' instead of 'fixed').

Change-Id: I34254d5df3a70fea58b993fd482d7e9de96ac77e
Partial-bug: #1453702
Closes-bug: #1485582

subject: default OS_VOLUME_API_VERSION to v2
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-24 15:40:06.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/volume/client.py'], 'message': 'default OS_VOLUME_API_VERSION to v2

Cinder is trying to deprecate/remove support for v1, so we should,
as a client library default to v2 and keep support for v1.

Related-Bug: 1467589

Change-Id: I732448a57fc3fd06a8d82ec0f0d2ace671036ca2
'}]
commit_message:
default OS_VOLUME_API_VERSION to v2

Cinder is trying to deprecate/remove support for v1, so we should,
as a client library default to v2 and keep support for v1.

Related-Bug: 1467589

[{'number': 15, 'created': '2015-08-26 02:15:34.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh', 'fixtures/scenario001.pp'], 'message': 'scenario001: tempest changes

1) To be able to benefit from tempest provided by nodepool images, we might
need to stop git cloning tempest and use the version in
/opt/git/openstack/tempest - it will enable us to use Zuul cloner and
have dependencies working between tempest and this repository.

2) Change /opt/git/openstack/tempest ownership to be owned by
tempest:tempest so we can update the repo and run tox without sudo.

3) Use zuul-cloner to update tempest local cache and benefits from Zuul
features (ie: Depends-On).

Depends-On: I6972baa00131fafe0e608b05e18da0e9486b916e
Change-Id: Ib7671da1eb4cd3e30400b9a05030c82a826e694e
'}]
commit_message:
scenario001: tempest changes

1) To be able to benefit from tempest provided by nodepool images, we might
need to stop git cloning tempest and use the version in
/opt/git/openstack/tempest - it will enable us to use Zuul cloner and
have dependencies working between tempest and this repository.

2) Change /opt/git/openstack/tempest ownership to be owned by
tempest:tempest so we can update the repo and run tox without sudo.

3) Use zuul-cloner to update tempest local cache and benefits from Zuul
features (ie: Depends-On).

Depends-On: I6972baa00131fafe0e608b05e18da0e9486b916e
Change-Id: Ib7671da1eb4cd3e30400b9a05030c82a826e694e

This change adds a network that spans all overcloud hosts to be
used for system management, access to DNS and Internet for patching,
or other infrastructure-related uses. No OpenStack services run on
this network, and there are no virtual IPs on the system management
network, it is solely an interface with a static IP. This change
makes the new system management network the default route for the
compute and storage nodes. These nodes previously had no default
route, so no access to infrastructure resources (like DNS or NTP).

This change also corrects the bond-with-vlans controller.yaml,
which had the bond bridge set to {get_input: bridge_name}. This
was incorrect, since when VLANs are used for the external net
the neutron external bridge is set to use the VLAN, and this
was defaulting to "br-ex".

Change-Id: I0f93973a388cc652c3d65b05ccb42dcae1f68600
'}]
commit_message:
Add a system management network to network isolation

This change adds a network that spans all overcloud hosts to be
used for system management, access to DNS and Internet for patching,
or other infrastructure-related uses. No OpenStack services run on
this network, and there are no virtual IPs on the system management
network, it is solely an interface with a static IP. This change
makes the new system management network the default route for the
compute and storage nodes. These nodes previously had no default
route, so no access to infrastructure resources (like DNS or NTP).

This change also corrects the bond-with-vlans controller.yaml,
which had the bond bridge set to {get_input: bridge_name}. This
was incorrect, since when VLANs are used for the external net
the neutron external bridge is set to use the VLAN, and this
was defaulting to "br-ex".

Change-Id: I0f93973a388cc652c3d65b05ccb42dcae1f68600

commit_message:
Handle empty PO files

Some projects like oslo.messaging and oslo.reports have now empty PO
files. Pushing empty files to transifex results in an error.

Check before pushing of the main file whether it's empty and only
push if it's non-empty - like it's done for the log-level PO
files already.

Change-Id: Ia757e9d4b88bc8eb7b1ce800a25fe0ed1ebe3e76

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-26 12:52:55.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_tasks_templates.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/orchestrator/tasks_templates.py'], 'message': "Fix pinning rules so a package from main can override the one from
universe

Current pinning rules don't match packages from the `universe' section.
As a result a customized MOS package (which always resides in the `main'
section) has lower priority than its Ubuntu counterpart:

 # apt-cache policy ohai
 ohai:
   Installed: (none)
   Candidate: 6.14.0-2
   Version table:
      6.14.0-2 0
         500 http://10.20.0.1/mirror/ubuntu/ trusty/universe amd64
Packages
      6.14.0-2~u14.04+mos1 0
         500 http://10.20.0.2:8080/2015.1.0-7.0/ubuntu/x86_64/
mos7.0/main amd64 Packages

As a result the original version of package (shipped with Ubuntu) gets
installed into the IBP image which might reintroduce bugs fixed by
patched packages and/or break features which require customized
packages.

Change-Id: I9326849751a8616fcdd4e3a57297bbb0f49def50
Co-Authored-By: Alexey Sheplyakov <asheplyakov@mirantis.com>
Closes-Bug: #1488844
"}]
commit_message:
Fix pinning rules so a package from main can override the one from
universe

Current pinning rules don't match packages from the `universe' section.
As a result a customized MOS package (which always resides in the `main'
section) has lower priority than its Ubuntu counterpart:

 # apt-cache policy ohai
 ohai:
   Installed: (none)
   Candidate: 6.14.0-2
   Version table:
      6.14.0-2 0
         500 http://10.20.0.1/mirror/ubuntu/ trusty/universe amd64
Packages
      6.14.0-2~u14.04+mos1 0
         500 http://10.20.0.2:8080/2015.1.0-7.0/ubuntu/x86_64/
mos7.0/main amd64 Packages

As a result the original version of package (shipped with Ubuntu) gets
installed into the IBP image which might reintroduce bugs fixed by
patched packages and/or break features which require customized
packages.

Change-Id: I9326849751a8616fcdd4e3a57297bbb0f49def50
Co-Authored-By: Alexey Sheplyakov <asheplyakov@mirantis.com>
Closes-Bug: #1488844

subject: Fix pinning rules so a package from main can override the one from universe
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3009, 'name': 'Vladimir Kozhukalov', 'email': 'kozhukalov@gmail.com', 'username': 'kozhukalov'}, {'_account_id': 8003, 'name': 'Aleksandr Gordeev', 'email': 'agordeev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'agordeev'}, {'_account_id': 8749, 'name': 'Evgeniy L', 'email': 'eli@mirantis.com', 'username': 'evgeniyl'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9582, 'name': 'Dmitry Burmistrov', 'email': 'burmistrovda@gmail.com', 'username': 'dburmistrov'}, {'_account_id': 10391, 'name': 'Ihor Kalnytskyi', 'email': 'ihor@kalnytskyi.com', 'username': 'ikalnitsky'}, {'_account_id': 12817, 'name': 'Sergiy Kulanov', 'email': 'sergey@kulanov.org.ua', 'username': 'skulanov'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-26 12:33:40.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/tests/test_build_utils.py', 'fuel_agent/utils/build.py'], 'message': "Fix pinning rules so a package from main can override the one from universe

Current pinning rules don't match packages from the `universe' section.
As a result a customized MOS package (which always resides in the `main'
section) has lower priority than its Ubuntu counterpart:

 # apt-cache policy ohai
 ohai:
   Installed: (none)
   Candidate: 6.14.0-2
   Version table:
      6.14.0-2 0
         500 http://10.20.0.1/mirror/ubuntu/ trusty/universe amd64 Packages
      6.14.0-2~u14.04+mos1 0
         500 http://10.20.0.2:8080/2015.1.0-7.0/ubuntu/x86_64/ mos7.0/main amd64 Packages

As a result the original version of package (shipped with Ubuntu) gets
installed into the IBP image which might reintroduce bugs fixed by
patched packages and/or break features which require customized
packages.

Closes-Bug: #1488844
Change-Id: I655b34bf0de80d26ba3f8c25fbb6b17bbaefc076
"}]
commit_message:
Fix pinning rules so a package from main can override the one from universe

Current pinning rules don't match packages from the `universe' section.
As a result a customized MOS package (which always resides in the `main'
section) has lower priority than its Ubuntu counterpart:

 # apt-cache policy ohai
 ohai:
   Installed: (none)
   Candidate: 6.14.0-2
   Version table:
      6.14.0-2 0
         500 http://10.20.0.1/mirror/ubuntu/ trusty/universe amd64 Packages
      6.14.0-2~u14.04+mos1 0
         500 http://10.20.0.2:8080/2015.1.0-7.0/ubuntu/x86_64/ mos7.0/main amd64 Packages

As a result the original version of package (shipped with Ubuntu) gets
installed into the IBP image which might reintroduce bugs fixed by
patched packages and/or break features which require customized
packages.

Closes-Bug: #1488844
Change-Id: I655b34bf0de80d26ba3f8c25fbb6b17bbaefc076

commit_message:
Use dict args for ceph_config slurp

Very minor style change, slurp was added with string args (slurp src=)
This patch converts that to using dictionary style args.

Change-Id: I6290d7c993aa561e1b1d2864ebc2884be41f9330
Implements: blueprint ceph-block-devices
(cherry picked from commit f7edf6d4a9b7b735753a155a93146bf78c8343a6)

subject: Enable Murano in congress libs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-26 01:11:01.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/devstack/lib/congress'], 'message': 'Enable Murano in congress libs

During migration to YAQL 1.0 Murano was broken and as a consequence,
was broken any installation of devstack with Murano.
Now, migration successfully finished and a new python-muranoclient
released.
Murano dsvm jobs is green now.
This patch enables back Murano drivers in Congress.

Change-Id: I1417e6f71bb61e7c64195591ca3333950bd64a15
'}]
commit_message:
Enable Murano in congress libs

During migration to YAQL 1.0 Murano was broken and as a consequence,
was broken any installation of devstack with Murano.
Now, migration successfully finished and a new python-muranoclient
released.
Murano dsvm jobs is green now.
This patch enables back Murano drivers in Congress.

Change-Id: I1417e6f71bb61e7c64195591ca3333950bd64a15

subject: Change tls and sni listener API attributes to ref
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-08-26 00:24:10.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/services/loadbalancer/plugin.py', 'neutron_lbaas/tests/unit/db/loadbalancer/test_db_loadbalancerv2.py', 'neutron_lbaas/extensions/loadbalancerv2.py', 'neutron_lbaas/db/loadbalancer/loadbalancer_dbv2.py', 'neutron_lbaas/tests/unit/drivers/radware/test_v2_plugin_driver.py', 'neutron_lbaas/tests/unit/services/loadbalancer/test_loadbalancer_plugin.py', 'neutron_lbaas/services/loadbalancer/data_models.py'], 'message': 'Change tls and sni listener API attributes to ref

It was originally thought that neutron lbaas would take a uuid for a tls
container that references a container of secrets.  This has changed due to the
fact that we will now take a URI for barbican containers, which makes the use
of default_tls_container_id and sni_container_ids inappropriate.  This changes
them to be default_tls_container_ref and sni_container_refs.

This patch does not change the db models or data models as that would make this
a much larger patch and due to time would be a lot to merge in by the
Liberty-3.  Since V2 API will probably lose the experimental tag this cycle, it
is important to make this change now while it is experimental.
This just changes the API to accept and return these attributes so
whenever the db and data model changes are done, it will not break API
backwards compatibility.

DocImpact
APIImpact

Change-Id: Iddc5d95fc6822e19e3166f9a6974dc56edd3193e
'}]
commit_message:
Change tls and sni listener API attributes to ref

It was originally thought that neutron lbaas would take a uuid for a tls
container that references a container of secrets.  This has changed due to the
fact that we will now take a URI for barbican containers, which makes the use
of default_tls_container_id and sni_container_ids inappropriate.  This changes
them to be default_tls_container_ref and sni_container_refs.

This patch does not change the db models or data models as that would make this
a much larger patch and due to time would be a lot to merge in by the
Liberty-3.  Since V2 API will probably lose the experimental tag this cycle, it
is important to make this change now while it is experimental.
This just changes the API to accept and return these attributes so
whenever the db and data model changes are done, it will not break API
backwards compatibility.

DocImpact
APIImpact

Change-Id: Iddc5d95fc6822e19e3166f9a6974dc56edd3193e

commit_message:

*/source/common in the openstack-manuals repository is a symbolic
