subject: remove test_update_host_with_extra_param
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 7244, 'name': 'Victor Howard', 'email': 'victor.r.howard@gmail.com', 'username': 'vichoward'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Maan', 'email': 'gmaan@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16986, 'name': 'Shuquan Huang', 'email': 'huang.shuquan@99cloud.net', 'username': 'shuquan'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-25 16:25:15.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/admin/test_hosts_negative.py'], 'message': "remove test_update_host_with_extra_param

This negative tempest test assumes that input validation will happen
on parameters before platform validation of the feature. This feature
is only supported on the xenapi backend.

There is no explicit guaruntee that input validation will always trump
platform validation, and when applying the relaxed validation of Nova
v2.0 on v2.1 on a platform that will return a NotImplemented, we might
get the NotImplemented back first.

Given that this really ends up being a xen platform specific test, and
a negative test at that, it doesn't bring a lot of value to tempest
and should just be deleted.

Change-Id: I513b54eeacee1486ea11b85913ab2d21727fc5f9
"}]
commit_message:
remove test_update_host_with_extra_param

This negative tempest test assumes that input validation will happen
on parameters before platform validation of the feature. This feature
is only supported on the xenapi backend.

There is no explicit guaruntee that input validation will always trump
platform validation, and when applying the relaxed validation of Nova
v2.0 on v2.1 on a platform that will return a NotImplemented, we might
get the NotImplemented back first.

Given that this really ends up being a xen platform specific test, and
a negative test at that, it doesn't bring a lot of value to tempest
and should just be deleted.

Change-Id: I513b54eeacee1486ea11b85913ab2d21727fc5f9

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-13 15:31:06.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/deactivate-image.rst'], 'message': 'Fix deactivate/reactivate error to 403 in spec

As it is, Glance correctly returns a 403 when one attempts to
deactivate (reactivate) an image that is not in active (deactivated)
status. A typo in the current spec incorrectly states that a 400
is returned in this situation. This patch corrects the typo.

No code fix is required.

Closes-Bug: #1445487

Change-Id: I7d7ed4716bffa69fa5f7f17145a1b64acc1cdbfa
'}]
commit_message:
Fix deactivate/reactivate error to 403 in spec

As it is, Glance correctly returns a 403 when one attempts to
deactivate (reactivate) an image that is not in active (deactivated)
status. A typo in the current spec incorrectly states that a 400
is returned in this situation. This patch corrects the typo.

No code fix is required.

Closes-Bug: #1445487

Change-Id: I7d7ed4716bffa69fa5f7f17145a1b64acc1cdbfa

"}]
commit_message:
[Reports] Use objects.Task._prepare_task_results()

This patch switches objects.Task.get_results() to using
workaround method Task._prepare_task_results(), so task results
have another structure (the main change is new `info' data),
so that is a step forward to usage of our new reports charts
classes (they require this aggregated info data)

Change-Id: Ib7c95b8b1d8111c501ba74efb4eecd46c2313ca2

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-25 20:24:08.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/process.rst'], 'message': 'Process updates

Update the process for core reviewers to add exactly one
CodeReview+2 to a review to consider it frozen. This is
preferable to freezing it with a Workflow-1 or CodeReview-2.

Change-Id: I9c48bae7b69c5bbeffd2994148b6d02d2150cce5

commit_message:
Process updates

Update the process for core reviewers to add exactly one
CodeReview+2 to a review to consider it frozen. This is
preferable to freezing it with a Workflow-1 or CodeReview-2.

Document the use of the add-reviewers.py script.

Change-Id: I9c48bae7b69c5bbeffd2994148b6d02d2150cce5

versions API is the first API to be versioned in Manila, the code in this

version codes and evaluates responses.

Change-Id: I4046f020f0e129dab639f99390367efda9cf4551
"}]
commit_message:
Add tempest tests for REST API microversions

This patch adds tempest tests that validate Manila's versions API. Since the
versions API is the first API to be versioned in Manila, the code in this
patch makes requests to invoke the versions API with valid and invalid
version codes and evaluates responses.

Change-Id: I4046f020f0e129dab639f99390367efda9cf4551

SCSI mappings associated with a recycled LPAR ID can cause attempts to
add new mappings to fail horribly.  This change set cleans up any
mappings associated with the LPAR ID of a freshly-created instance.

Relies on recent pypowervm addition on topic orphaned_mappings

Change-Id: I0281dff0a011597ea8d6a4b484fdfacd70c4367c
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Delete stale mappings during spawn

SCSI mappings associated with a recycled LPAR ID can cause attempts to
add new mappings to fail horribly.  This change set cleans up any
mappings associated with the LPAR ID of a freshly-created instance.

Relies on recent pypowervm addition on topic orphaned_mappings

Change-Id: I0281dff0a011597ea8d6a4b484fdfacd70c4367c

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-08-25 14:13:46.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/common/test_notifications.py'], 'message': "Adds a notification testcase for unbound methods

Unbound methods can't be used as a callback because they can't be called
unless they are passed an instance of the class they are defined in as
the first argument. We don't do that.

Change-Id: I0924b4767a087d21a7fdd478b04bf6b7d8e2666b
"}]
commit_message:
Adds a notification testcase for unbound methods

Unbound methods can't be used as a callback because they can't be called
unless they are passed an instance of the class they are defined in as
the first argument. We don't do that.

Change-Id: I0924b4767a087d21a7fdd478b04bf6b7d8e2666b

commit_message:
Forbid changing of the fuelweb_admin network

'NetworkConfigurationValidator' is updated with method 'prepare_data'
which filters off Fuel admin network parameters from input data if
update is done for default node group.

Change-Id: Iaa56b8983730de36c6070a28b033a087b3d4bd0d
Closes-Bug: #1486632

commit_message:
Add methods for share instances in Share API

This commit adds a possibility to create/delete
share instances and allow/disable access to individual
share instances through Share API. It's required minimum
in Manila core to implement share migration functionality.

Also this commit updates methods in Share RPC API,
Share manager, Scheduler RPC API and Share manager
to maintain consistency.

Partially implements bp share-instances

Change-Id: I3af93071b5851944b59a3c5b1a0c2296e1267bfe

subject: Fix update requirements mixed case in extras
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-19 13:13:27.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_requirements/project.py'], 'message': "Fix update requirements mixed case in extras

When an extras entry in setup.cfg contains uppercase characters the
update script generated an invalid setup.cfg where the requirements
aren't indented. For example, the setup.cfg has:

 MongoDB =
   pymongo>=3.0.2

The update resulted in:

 MongoDB =
 pymongo>=3.0.2

The correct result is to include the leading spaces for the
requirements.

Change-Id: I8f8bf699ee67a6dbb538bf3dd8388642919acf9d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix update requirements mixed case in extras

When an extras entry in setup.cfg contains uppercase characters the
update script generated an invalid setup.cfg where the requirements
aren't indented. For example, the setup.cfg has:

 MongoDB =
   pymongo>=3.0.2

The update resulted in:

 MongoDB =
 pymongo>=3.0.2

The correct result is to include the leading spaces for the
requirements.

Change-Id: I8f8bf699ee67a6dbb538bf3dd8388642919acf9d

subject: Reference with the correct region id in 'Region' table
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-24 08:01:56.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/catalog/controllers.py'], 'message': "Reference with the correct region id in 'Region' table

MYSQL defaults to case-insensitive string comparison while SQLite is
case sensitive string comparison. SQLAlchemy cannot provide an unified
approach to handle with different DB, as a work around we substitute
the region id passed in with the actually region id in DB to align the
data in 'endpoint' table with the data in 'region' table.

Change-Id: Ia3dd8a7ba5ce60e8bc73d9b2ff980b1f9e3254f3
Closes-Bug: #1400589
"}]
commit_message:
Reference with the correct region id in 'Region' table

MYSQL defaults to case-insensitive string comparison while SQLite is
case sensitive string comparison. SQLAlchemy cannot provide an unified
approach to handle with different DB, as a work around we substitute
the region id passed in with the actually region id in DB to align the
data in 'endpoint' table with the data in 'region' table.

Change-Id: Ia3dd8a7ba5ce60e8bc73d9b2ff980b1f9e3254f3
Closes-Bug: #1400589

[{'number': 12, 'created': '2014-12-31 17:40:35.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/contrib/endpoint_filter/migrate_repo/versions/004_add_endpoint_group_id_primary_key.py', 'keystone/contrib/endpoint_filter/migrate_repo/versions/002_add_endpoint_groups.py'], 'message': "Add primary key to the endpoint_group id column.

The endpoint_group.id column missed primary key constraint.
project_endpoint_group table provides foreign key pointed the endpoint_group.id
column. Any attempt to apply the migration raises operational error
(errno 150 for MySQL).

Modify existing migration. Addition of a primary key
doesn't affect data and database topology and this migration anyway can't be
applied with sql backends except SQLite. This is the case when we
should modify existing migration. Added specific non-reverse migration
for existing SQLIte deployment.

Closes-Bug: #1397890
Change-Id: I499833f17a0383c07e8d400ac3e124d9b470bcb9
"}]
commit_message:
Add primary key to the endpoint_group id column.

The endpoint_group.id column missed primary key constraint.
project_endpoint_group table provides foreign key pointed the endpoint_group.id
column. Any attempt to apply the migration raises operational error
(errno 150 for MySQL).

Modify existing migration. Addition of a primary key
doesn't affect data and database topology and this migration anyway can't be
applied with sql backends except SQLite. This is the case when we
should modify existing migration. Added specific non-reverse migration
for existing SQLIte deployment.

Closes-Bug: #1397890
Change-Id: I499833f17a0383c07e8d400ac3e124d9b470bcb9

commit_message:
Explicit MySQL engine designation.

Some deployments default to use of MyISAM engine which doesn't support foreign
key constraint. Thus we must explicitly sign MySQL engine as InnoDB at
every table declares foreign keys or which is a fk target.

Closes-Bug: #1398748
Change-Id: I08afe3f486c74586c6a70a2732610ec5d7ea2ee5

commit_message:
Use metadata.create_all() to fill a test database

Since implementation of I47444c4944f08535227718e368a1950c45c6cb32 we
guarantee identity of models and migrations, so `create_all` will be
totally safe. So we don't need to synchronize migrations before tests
start.

Change-Id: Ief6a4c5fec8143a4b9698e215b091ebbac880fb7
Closes-Bug: #1319370

subject: Allowed owners to delete token with v2 API
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-13 15:50:50.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/token/controllers.py', 'keystone/common/wsgi.py'], 'message': 'Allowed owners to delete token with v2 API

When "assert_admin" only allows admin roles to delete tokens with v2 API,
those member users logout from horizon always can not delete their own
tokens resulting in large numbers of redundant tokens.
In fact, unuseful tokens should be allowed to delete by "admin_or_owner".
Besides, the policy.json unable to properly handle "delete_token" because
of the improper parameters pass to wrapper "protected" and oslo_policy.

Change-Id: I386c3e074790a4cdf4569929cc8f38560a35772a
Closes bug: 1443104
'}]
commit_message:
Allowed owners to delete token with v2 API

When "assert_admin" only allows admin roles to delete tokens with v2 API,
those member users logout from horizon always can not delete their own
tokens resulting in large numbers of redundant tokens.
In fact, unuseful tokens should be allowed to delete by "admin_or_owner".
Besides, the policy.json unable to properly handle "delete_token" because
of the improper parameters pass to wrapper "protected" and oslo_policy.

Change-Id: I386c3e074790a4cdf4569929cc8f38560a35772a
Closes bug: 1443104

subject: Move httpd under keystone root folder
revisions:

The advantages to this patch are:
- The service configuration files are now all contained in etc/
- It's easier to configure keystone under Apache with the
  httpd/keystone.py module installed in the site-packages.
- httpd/keystone.py can now get the same pep8/hacking/bandit

Change-Id: Ic4b800f5d49ebfae1d81e1fb37125bfccb10bb0e

commit_message:
Move httpd under keystone root folder

The httpd/ directory contains source for running the keystone
WSGI app under apache, yet package based installs do not contain
this needed file because it's not contained in the root keystone
source folder.

The advantages to this patch are:
- The service configuration files are now all contained in etc/
- It's easier to configure keystone under Apache with the
  httpd/keystone.py module installed in the site-packages.
- httpd/keystone.py can now get the same pep8/hacking/bandit
  checking as other source.
- The README seems redundant after the move.

Closes-Bug: #1441733

Change-Id: Ic4b800f5d49ebfae1d81e1fb37125bfccb10bb0e

commit_message:
Handle sessions correctly in convenience client

The base client to which you provide a version expects to take a URL
even when there is a session provided. If a session is provided we
should be finding the URL from the catalog.

Change-Id: If4d85904aaa0bd2b3600bfcdc2c17ffaa519f5ad
Closes-Bug: #1369300

commit_message:
Improve documentation of RBAC policy behavior

This improves the existing developer documentation around RBAC
policy behaviour.  In particular, the following topics are covered:

- policy "rule statement" definition
- "default" rule behavior
- boolean combination or rules/matches
- empty rule behavior
- policy interaction with API calls with hard-coded restrictions

Partial-bug: #1373599
Change-Id: I9c2e4e221e78664aa633b194f1e17ea08b506d19

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-10-17 16:12:04.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/tests/v2_0/test_endpoints.py', 'keystoneclient/v2_0/tokens.py', 'keystoneclient/v2_0/endpoints.py'], 'message': 'Fix listing of endpoints for a token

The client is currently failing to list endpoints for a token because it is
looking for a non-existing token key in the response from Keystone:

def endpoints(self, token):
    return self._get(/tokens/%s/endpoints % base.getid(token), token)

It needs to be changed to look for the endpoints key instead and parse its
value correctly.

Closes-Bug: #1315798

Change-Id: I2abc6b7a2b4fa0c03defa5d05778851656f3b15d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix listing of endpoints for a token

The client is currently failing to list endpoints for a token because it is
looking for a non-existing token key in the response from Keystone:

def endpoints(self, token):
    return self._get(/tokens/%s/endpoints % base.getid(token), token)

It needs to be changed to look for the endpoints key instead and parse its
value correctly.

Closes-Bug: #1315798

Change-Id: I2abc6b7a2b4fa0c03defa5d05778851656f3b15d

[{'number': 20, 'created': '2014-11-27 04:13:07.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/common/test_utils.py', 'keystone/common/config.py', 'keystone/tests/fakeldap.py', 'keystone/assignment/core.py', 'keystone/common/ldap/core.py', 'keystone/tests/test_backend_ldap.py', 'keystone/assignment/backends/ldap.py', 'keystone/common/utils.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/ldap.py', 'keystone/tests/test_backend.py'], 'message': "better handling for empty/None ldap values

When adding an LDAP entry, if there are attributes
with values of None or empty - '', [], (), {} - just
skip adding the attribute.

When modifying an LDAP entry, if the new value is
None or empty, just delete the attribute from LDAP.
If the entry's objectclass requires the attribute to
be present, the modify will fail.

When reading an LDAP entry, if the entry is missing
attributes that a client expects should be present
in the entry, add the attribute to the object with
a value of None.  The list of attributes expected to
be in an entry is set in the Api object in the
attribute_options_names - for example -
keystone.identity.backends.ldap.UserApi.\
attribute_options_names

Change-Id: I3e1b298ed2d3464212c8daab60af5f01e4981bd0
Closes-Bug: #1282676
"}]
commit_message:
better handling for empty/None ldap values

When adding an LDAP entry, if there are attributes
with values of None or empty - '', [], (), {} - just
skip adding the attribute.

When modifying an LDAP entry, if the new value is
None or empty, just delete the attribute from LDAP.
If the entry's objectclass requires the attribute to
be present, the modify will fail.

When reading an LDAP entry, if the entry is missing
attributes that a client expects should be present
in the entry, add the attribute to the object with
a value of None.  The list of attributes expected to
be in an entry is set in the Api object in the
attribute_options_names - for example -
keystone.identity.backends.ldap.UserApi.\
attribute_options_names

Change-Id: I3e1b298ed2d3464212c8daab60af5f01e4981bd0
Closes-Bug: #1282676

commit_message:
Refactor network configuration verification handler

Now NetworkConfigurationHandler and NetworkConfigurationVerifyHandler
use the same verification methods and all verification is moved to the
validators.

Related-Bug: #1483240

commit_message:
Return none for missing endpoints

The plugin base defines returning None if there is no endpoint available
however the service catalog raises an error. This will generally not be
a large change as the error that is raised from the service catalog is
the same as the one that is raised by the session when None is found.

Change-Id: Ibe798b7b381a9e85bb418c6d8a72d88310b405db
Closes-Bug: #1428447

commit_message:
Enforce that some plugin options are required

Oslo.config has the ability to mark certain options as required. This
means that we can allow plugins to specify some additional validation for
the loading process.

Closes-Bug: #1420099
Change-Id: I05defd61ba51041c0168eae95691546f009bb93e

revisions:
[{'number': 29, 'created': '2015-01-09 02:27:26.000000000', 'files': ['etc/policy.v3cloudsample.json'], 'message': "common cloud policy logic

the v3 cloud policy file reflects the goal of
making the rules for each individual API as simple
and clear as possible, with suport for role inheritance
in the rules that define the roles.

The logic for determining whether a given project or domain
matches the request has been collected to a common block of
code.  While they do not reflect all possibilities, the
approach should be simple to extend.  Ideally, the policy
rule type would expand to make it possible to let the API
policy enforcement points declare what objects should
participate in policy enforcement.

There are a handful of blank rules in the file to cover
a unit test that are left in place to avoid making changes
to both the rules and Python code, but they can safely be
removed along with the unit test in a future commit.

There was concern in previous patches that the logic to determine
domain_matches or project_matches would allow for spurious rules,
but the way that these API are called, there is no way that, for
example, on a create_user call, the caller could set a group object:
there is no group parameter in the method call.  Thus the calls are
locked down to the values explicitly set.  The 'target' values are all
fetched from the backend data stores and cannot be modified by
the callers.

blueprint modify-policy

Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Duarte <rodrigods@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena de Sousa Filho <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Henrique Truta <henrique@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Thiago Paiva <thiagop@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Adam Young <ayoung@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I6b81cd4e599ed00827dff4fb644bc0a7c909ac59"}]
commit_message:
common cloud policy logic

the v3 cloud policy file reflects the goal of
making the rules for each individual API as simple
and clear as possible, with suport for role inheritance
in the rules that define the roles.

The logic for determining whether a given project or domain
matches the request has been collected to a common block of
code.  While they do not reflect all possibilities, the
approach should be simple to extend.  Ideally, the policy
rule type would expand to make it possible to let the API
policy enforcement points declare what objects should
participate in policy enforcement.

There are a handful of blank rules in the file to cover
a unit test that are left in place to avoid making changes
to both the rules and Python code, but they can safely be
removed along with the unit test in a future commit.

There was concern in previous patches that the logic to determine
domain_matches or project_matches would allow for spurious rules,
but the way that these API are called, there is no way that, for
example, on a create_user call, the caller could set a group object:
there is no group parameter in the method call.  Thus the calls are
locked down to the values explicitly set.  The 'target' values are all
fetched from the backend data stores and cannot be modified by
the callers.

blueprint modify-policy

Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Duarte <rodrigods@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena de Sousa Filho <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Henrique Truta <henrique@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Thiago Paiva <thiagop@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Adam Young <ayoung@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I6b81cd4e599ed00827dff4fb644bc0a7c909ac59

commit_message:
add timestamp to project and role

Give a simple way to determine when Project and Role resources were
created and when they were last modified: add created_at and
updated_at attributes for Project and Role.

bp model-timestamps

Change-Id: I24d01c70614b521d91a42491d0f5bd476b29105f

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-05-05 09:10:47.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'keystone/tests/unit/ksfixtures/database.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_sql_upgrade.py'], 'message': 'Run SQL migration tests on PostgreSQL and MySQL

This approach creates a new database with random name for each migration
test. This will avoid migration tests of race conditions and reduce
tests intersection.
For testing on a real database backend you need to set up a user
openstack_citest with password openstack_citest  and a database named
'openstack_citest' on localhost. This user must have permissions to
create and drop databases. Please note, that  ``openstack_citest`` user
credentials will be used only for initial connection to the database.

Refactored SqlUpgradeTests class to use it with "opportunistic" test
cases - removed unused code, used methods named _pre_upgrade_<rev_id>,
_check_<rev_id> instead of custom tests for each migration,
removed self.metadata usage.
Test test_all_tables_innodb() skipped for now

Change-Id: I69feb658d629643e281541fe6af7b11bbfa85da6
'}]
commit_message:
Run SQL migration tests on PostgreSQL and MySQL

This approach creates a new database with random name for each migration
test. This will avoid migration tests of race conditions and reduce
tests intersection.
For testing on a real database backend you need to set up a user
openstack_citest with password openstack_citest  and a database named
'openstack_citest' on localhost. This user must have permissions to
create and drop databases. Please note, that  ``openstack_citest`` user
credentials will be used only for initial connection to the database.

Refactored SqlUpgradeTests class to use it with "opportunistic" test
cases - removed unused code, used methods named _pre_upgrade_<rev_id>,
_check_<rev_id> instead of custom tests for each migration,
removed self.metadata usage.
Test test_all_tables_innodb() skipped for now

Change-Id: I69feb658d629643e281541fe6af7b11bbfa85da6

commit_message:
Re-use list_role_assignments wherever is possible

The assignment manager contains several methods
to list roles, actors and targets based on role
assignments.

Now they use the list_role_assignments method,
instead of repeating the code for expanding
inherited and group assignments.

Implements: bp assignment-manager-cleanup

Change-Id: I2246de838fbbeee8149fbbd76d8c2ffa85621b67

commit_message:
Refactor: create a helper function to create users

Refactoring to extract sample code use in tests to method.
Every time a user is going to be created the user_ref, create
and associate a password, crete the user in keystone and then
assign again the password.
This patch provides a single method to be used when creating a
user.

Change-Id: Ifa4a98570d009be7195c0badd3ce5e201285c1b0

commit_message:
Add a module to work with LDAP filters and DNs

As I started to write new feature for LDAP backend I found out that I
have to keep track of all little nasty things like formatting filters
and DNs and escaping them. This process is rather error-prone so I
decided to aggregate all necessary pieces in a separate module with
clean interface.

Change-Id: Iffdba2d650561d8ec3581a286be18b04b38a9028

subject: Remove kwargs from Session.request
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-11 23:52:50.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/tests/test_session.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/test_shell.py', 'keystoneclient/session.py'], 'message': "Remove kwargs from Session.request

Session.request was written to pass all kwargs through to
requests.request. This has not been a problem so far as they are
generally options we want to allow. However it means we have an
interface that we don't control or document and it would be better to
have this information controlled by our session so we can evaluate how
new requests params affect us.

Change-Id: I2d40babd70e82a5db51429d67c29739881b9f753
"}]
commit_message:
Remove kwargs from Session.request

Session.request was written to pass all kwargs through to
requests.request. This has not been a problem so far as they are
generally options we want to allow. However it means we have an
interface that we don't control or document and it would be better to
have this information controlled by our session so we can evaluate how
new requests params affect us.

Change-Id: I2d40babd70e82a5db51429d67c29739881b9f753

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-10-13 21:18:26.000000000', 'files': ['etc/keystone.conf.sample', 'doc/source/developing.rst', 'keystone/common/config.py', 'doc/source/configuration.rst', 'keystone/common/kvs/backends/memcached.py', 'keystone/tests/test_kvs.py', 'keystone/token/persistence/backends/memcache.py'], 'message': 'Add memcached_backend configuration

The raw "kvs" configuration is not easy for user to pass
extra dogpile config options to the token memcached backend.

If the token chooses memcached as driver, this patch adds
a memcached_backend option in keystone.conf, which allow
user to choose the alternative memcached backend directly.

Currently, the following backends are supported:
memcached, pylibmc, bmemcached, pooled_memcached

The default memcached backend is "memcached".

Change-Id: I520712755c607ec0f002b669f3a2157701c8de31
Closes-Bug: #1360553
'}]
commit_message:
Add memcached_backend configuration

The raw "kvs" configuration is not easy for user to pass
extra dogpile config options to the token memcached backend.

If the token chooses memcached as driver, this patch adds
a memcached_backend option in keystone.conf, which allow
user to choose the alternative memcached backend directly.

Currently, the following backends are supported:
memcached, pylibmc, bmemcached, pooled_memcached

The default memcached backend is "memcached".

Change-Id: I520712755c607ec0f002b669f3a2157701c8de31
Closes-Bug: #1360553

subject: Keystoneclient doesn't look at cached auth_ref in keyring
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-30 00:03:34.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/shell.py'], 'message': "Keystoneclient doesn't look at cached auth_ref in keyring

Keystoneclient tries to save the auth_ref in the keyring in
store_auth_ref_in_keyring and the auth_ref retrieval happens in
get_auth_ref_from_keyring during authentication. Please note
that both these methods are part of httpclient.py and not shell.py.
Hence, in shell.py, before checking for [service_token, os_endpoint]
or [os_username, os_password], shell should verify whether the
auth_ref is available with keyring. The above check for arguments
actually happens before instantiation of the client. Hence, the shell
always expects to be provided with [service_token, os_endpoint] pair
or the [os_username, os_password] pair. We need to do auth_check
after instantiation of the client

Change-Id: Ic0a873fdebb502e3892053eae318bb605e58b44e
Closes-Bug: 1357567
"}]
commit_message:
Keystoneclient doesn't look at cached auth_ref in keyring

Keystoneclient tries to save the auth_ref in the keyring in
store_auth_ref_in_keyring and the auth_ref retrieval happens in
get_auth_ref_from_keyring during authentication. Please note
that both these methods are part of httpclient.py and not shell.py.
Hence, in shell.py, before checking for [service_token, os_endpoint]
or [os_username, os_password], shell should verify whether the
auth_ref is available with keyring. The above check for arguments
actually happens before instantiation of the client. Hence, the shell
always expects to be provided with [service_token, os_endpoint] pair
or the [os_username, os_password] pair. We need to do auth_check
after instantiation of the client

Change-Id: Ic0a873fdebb502e3892053eae318bb605e58b44e
Closes-Bug: 1357567

auth plugins don't store sensitive data such as usernames and passwords
and so the restored plugin cannot be used to re-authenticate. This may

Implements: blueprint auth-plugin-serialize

commit_message:
Auth plugin serialization

Provides a way to serialize and restore auth plugins. When serialized
auth plugins don't store sensitive data such as usernames and passwords
and so the restored plugin cannot be used to re-authenticate. This may
need to be added later.

Change-Id: Ia225f1bae298d6bfe1d1045533fd6e9b75e209c3
Implements: blueprint auth-plugin-serialize

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-26 06:24:27.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/contrib/auth/v3/saml2.py'], 'message': 'Fix Accept header in SAML2 requests

The ; separator allows providing parameters to a type not separating

Closes-Bug: #1488722

commit_message:
Fix Accept header in SAML2 requests

The ; separator allows providing parameters to a type not separating
type options. This means that in strict type checks like those performed
by mod_auth_mellon the check for accept type fails.

Change-Id: Ieeaa74b304921daef68497fec77cc6629ab2f0a2
Closes-Bug: #1488722

commit_message:
Add a configuration for the directory to generate gmr

If projects choose to have their own config parameter, they
can use setup_autorun's log_dir parameter. if they want
to let oslo.report's manage the configuration, they will
have to call set_defaults and then use setup_autorun's
conf parameter.

commit_message:
Modify the pagination message to show total count

Modifies the itemCount filter to allow for an optional parameter
that indicates the total count of records (not just what is shown),
and to display that total count if provided.

Closes-Bug: 1484193

Change-Id: Ic351f4e662ba2dc879218a04ac2b77361765bd49

requests-kerberos>=0.6;python_version=='2.7' # MIT

commit_message:
Update pbr to 1.6.0

pbr 1.6.0 is needed for projects like networking-ovn and
python-keystoneclient-kerberos to fix parsing of requirements lines
like:
requests-kerberos>=0.6;python_version=='2.7' # MIT

Without the fix, they cannot use such requirement lines.

Change-Id: I84e15cd8acc085640b7d62d68de51409b4e8d105

It also deprecates the scrubber_datadir, cleanup_scrubber, and

commit_message:
Purge dead file-backed scrubber queue code

The file-backed scrubber can no longer be used (see 66d24bb), but the
code for it is still in place, including several configuration
options, abstraction layers, and so on. This commit removes that dead
code.

It also deprecates the scrubber_datadir, cleanup_scrubber, and
cleanup_scrubber_time options, which are no longer
functional. "Cleanup" mode is also removed, as it is now equivalent to
the normal running mode of the scrubber.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: 1427929
Change-Id: I3c2a43acee21c685a2de3a7b67ba831548bc27df

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 7244, 'name': 'Victor Howard', 'email': 'victor.r.howard@gmail.com', 'username': 'vichoward'}, {'_account_id': 7350, 'name': 'Jordan Pittier', 'email': 'jordan.pittier@gmail.com', 'username': 'JordanP'}, {'_account_id': 7428, 'name': 'Yaroslav Lobankov', 'email': 'lobankovyv@gmail.com', 'username': 'ylobankov'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Maan', 'email': 'gmaan@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-18 08:23:06.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/services/compute/json/hypervisor_client.py', 'tempest/api/compute/admin/test_hypervisor_negative.py', 'tempest/api/compute/admin/test_hypervisor.py'], 'message': "Return complete response from hypervisor_client

Currently compute hypervisor_client returns Response by removing
top key from Response.
For example-
return service_client.ResponseBody(resp, body['hypervisor'])

As service clients are in direction to move to Tempest-lib, all
service clients should return Response without any truncation.
One good example is Resource pagination links which are lost with current
way of return value. Resource pagination links are present in parallel
(not inside) to top key of Response.

This patch makes compute hypervisor_client to return complete
Response body.

Change-Id: Icf782e4469fcecba773b3187c1b36d9d49829c93
Implements: blueprint method-return-value-and-move-service-clients-to-lib
"}]
commit_message:
Return complete response from hypervisor_client

Currently compute hypervisor_client returns Response by removing
top key from Response.
For example-
return service_client.ResponseBody(resp, body['hypervisor'])

As service clients are in direction to move to Tempest-lib, all
service clients should return Response without any truncation.
One good example is Resource pagination links which are lost with current
way of return value. Resource pagination links are present in parallel
(not inside) to top key of Response.

This patch makes compute hypervisor_client to return complete
Response body.

Change-Id: Icf782e4469fcecba773b3187c1b36d9d49829c93
Implements: blueprint method-return-value-and-move-service-clients-to-lib

commit_message:
Fix TestOvnPlugin.test_create_port_security

Neutron merged:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/201141/

Which broke the test. This patch unbreaks it, yay!

While we're at it, also hardcode neutron's api_workers config option
to 0.  This is a known bug in networking-ovn.

Co-authored-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I6254cfc85644b00d07a66e8264ea2af89da994d8

commit_message:
Clean up Compute v2 extensions

os-availability-zone extension was missing a call and incorrectly
described the "GET" calls
os-availability-zone extension had unsupported XML examples
os-quota-sets "defaults" resource was in wrong place
os-volume updated to show v2 rather than v1.1

Change-Id: I0b296b07358ac69cc733d09b267d7a829f33197d
Closes-Bug: #1485818

commit_message:
Added generate_network_scheme for 7.0

This change adds generate_network_scheme method for 7.0 instead of inherit it.
Now generate_network_scheme for 7.0 supports non-default network groups.

Change-Id: Ib89594867c57b3aeb1b6503fed87c291ca3fd308
Closes-bug: #1483307

Currently, the name and command for starting/restarting service in Ceph module
is incorrect for Ubuntu system (should be 'ceph-all', not just 'ceph'). Because
of this, on the reinstalled system with existing Ceph OSD devices the Puppet
module fails to activate those devices when the service is started.

Add parameter to params.pp manifest to specify a name of the service depending
on the operating system family.

Change-Id: I86f8b455479f84fd061ef4985a5e1371c039cf77
Closes-bug: 1474510
"}]
commit_message:
Parametrize Ceph service title by OS variant

Currently, the name and command for starting/restarting service in Ceph module
is incorrect for Ubuntu system (should be 'ceph-all', not just 'ceph'). Because
of this, on the reinstalled system with existing Ceph OSD devices the Puppet
module fails to activate those devices when the service is started.

Add parameter to params.pp manifest to specify a name of the service depending
on the operating system family.

Change-Id: I86f8b455479f84fd061ef4985a5e1371c039cf77
Closes-bug: 1474510

commit_message:
Add resource params to reflect WSME 0.8 fixes

Before, WSME would ignore fields that didn't exist in the resource, but
with the version 0.8.0 WSME will raise HTTP 400 (BadRequest) when one
attempt to create a resource with nonexistent fields.

Change-Id: Ie13038ff8a2f4988fa3dc97bdfbd5daf3d35a5f6
Closes-Bug: #1488873

commit_message:
Added ftp urls handling to network checker

This change allows network checker to properly check availability of
urls using ftp protocol. Basically, this change checks if ftp urls are
possible to open with urllib2.urlopen function.

Add requirements.txt to test-requirements.txt

Add running url_access_checker tests to tox

Add six to network_checker requirements.txt, nailgun.spec,
debian/control

Change-Id: I89c3d4635e9f58d19eab8440c720f1900e81aea4
Closes-Bug: #1488001

commit_message:
Add master node IP to certificate in Nginx

To easier client access and certificate import/management,
IP address of master node added into SAN field of certificate.

Upstream pull-request: https://github.com/camptocamp/puppet-openssl/pull/50
Closes-Bug: #1488082

Change-Id: Ia9507d4404512f8b872c1d526014af25e9c115dc

commit_message:
Add port owner to logical port object

Using this we can add the correct flow when the port is
created and dont have to handle modifying existing flows.
(Sometimes the logical port is added before the router port)

Fix a problems that was in L3 application when switch connection
goes down

Change-Id: Id0c204a0f9e026013747e67dd8795e93c999bba0

- We should do apache stop/start during apache.pp task to avoid
  apache errors like this:
  "Configuration error: The MPM cannot be changed during restart"
- We should check/wait for keystone haproxy backend in all tasks
  that work with apache service after keystone configuration.

Change-Id: I22216546f610a63c77fecf564d66f923ade7b836
Closes-bug: #1488847
'}]
commit_message:
Check for keystone haproxy backend in horizon task

- We should do apache stop/start during apache.pp task to avoid
  apache errors like this:
  "Configuration error: The MPM cannot be changed during restart"
- We should check/wait for keystone haproxy backend in all tasks
  that work with apache service after keystone configuration.
  The only task that was missing this check is horizon.pp

Change-Id: I22216546f610a63c77fecf564d66f923ade7b836
Closes-bug: #1488847

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-24 08:40:40.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/base.py', 'tempest/api/compute/servers/test_create_server.py', 'tempest/api/compute/servers/test_server_group.py', 'tempest/cmd/cleanup_service.py', 'tempest/services/compute/json/server_groups_client.py'], 'message': "Return complete resp from server_groups_client

Currently compute server_groups_client returns Response by
removing top key from Response.
For example-
 return service_client.ResponseBody(resp, body['server_group'])

As service clients are in direction to move to Tempest-lib, all
service clients should return Response without any truncation.
One good example is Resource pagination links which are lost with current
way of return value. Resource pagination links are present in parallel
(not inside) to top key of Response.

This patch makes compute server_groups_client to return
complete Response body.

Change-Id: I18c2f30558c32eacc65bb012fffa1e8fa94fa1c3
Implements: blueprint method-return-value-and-move-service-clients-to-lib
"}]
commit_message:
Return complete resp from server_groups_client

Currently compute server_groups_client returns Response by
removing top key from Response.
For example-
 return service_client.ResponseBody(resp, body['server_group'])

As service clients are in direction to move to Tempest-lib, all
service clients should return Response without any truncation.
One good example is Resource pagination links which are lost with current
way of return value. Resource pagination links are present in parallel
(not inside) to top key of Response.

This patch makes compute server_groups_client to return
complete Response body.

Change-Id: I18c2f30558c32eacc65bb012fffa1e8fa94fa1c3
Implements: blueprint method-return-value-and-move-service-clients-to-lib

commit_message:
Huawei driver support smartcache and smartpartition

Manila "share types" may contain qualified extra-specs -
extra-specs that have significance for the backend driver
and the CapabilityFilter.

This commit adds the following qualified extra-specs:
  * capabilities:huawei_smartcache='<is> True'
    huawei_smartcache:cachename=test_cache_name
  * capabilities:huawei_smartpartition='<is> True'
    huawei_smartpartition:partitionname=test_partition_name

Change-Id: I909b4a0bdd1b49bfabe374068d17529d25ff9846
Implements: blueprint huawei-driver-support-smartcache-smartpartition

subject: Implement get/set/delete multiple keys for dictionary backend
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-25 01:30:22.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_cache/tests/test_dict_backend.py', 'oslo_cache/backends/dictionary.py'], 'message': "Implement get/set/delete multiple keys for dictionary backend

For some Nova scenarios, we will need suppot for
set_multi/get_multi/delete_multi for writing to either
memcache or dictionary backend. So let's add support for
operating on multiple keys. Note that if we don't implement
this the default CacheBackend class throws NotImplementedError

Closes-Bug: #1483322
Change-Id: I1aca9e65b3be038a507ced8dd039c5413d6c4ac2
"}]
commit_message:
Implement get/set/delete multiple keys for dictionary backend

For some Nova scenarios, we will need suppot for
set_multi/get_multi/delete_multi for writing to either
memcache or dictionary backend. So let's add support for
operating on multiple keys. Note that if we don't implement
this the default CacheBackend class throws NotImplementedError

Closes-Bug: #1483322
Change-Id: I1aca9e65b3be038a507ced8dd039c5413d6c4ac2

subject: Move _(get|inc)_counter out of QueueController
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-14 07:51:19.000000000', 'files': ['zaqar/storage/mongodb/messages.py', 'zaqar/tests/unit/storage/test_impl_mongodb.py'], 'message': "Move _(get|inc)_counter out of QueueController

These 2 counter utilities are used in the message controller as a way to
paginate and guarantee FIFO. The counter was kept in the queue record
since it provides a centralized place for it to live in. However, since
we moved the QueueController to the control plane, we can't expect the
QueueController to be on the same sotrage as the MessageController.

The patch keeps the old methods around for backwards compatibility.
It'll check if the QueueController has these methods and call those
rather than the new ones to avoid reseting the counter. This should
eventually go away but for now, it's probably the best we can do.

Closes-bug: #1484826
Change-Id: I57a9c4baa1d6c98fb938526ed90d89b6e0e21ed9
"}]
commit_message:
Move _(get|inc)_counter out of QueueController

These 2 counter utilities are used in the message controller as a way to
paginate and guarantee FIFO. The counter was kept in the queue record
since it provides a centralized place for it to live in. However, since
we moved the QueueController to the control plane, we can't expect the
QueueController to be on the same sotrage as the MessageController.

The patch keeps the old methods around for backwards compatibility.
It'll check if the QueueController has these methods and call those
rather than the new ones to avoid reseting the counter. This should
eventually go away but for now, it's probably the best we can do.

Closes-bug: #1484826
Change-Id: I57a9c4baa1d6c98fb938526ed90d89b6e0e21ed9

subject: Add ebtables to neutron agent configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-08-09 18:51:26.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_neutron/tasks/neutron_post_install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_neutron/templates/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini.j2', 'playbooks/roles/os_neutron/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_neutron/files/rootwrap.d/ebtables.filters'], 'message': 'Add ebtables to neutron agent configuration

Neutron now uses ebtables as an extra security layer for ARP
spoof filtering. This patch adds the ebtables package and
rootwrap to the neutron role to ensure that the agent is able
to use this subsystem. Without it the networking from the
instances to the L3 router will fail.

Co-Authored-By: Evan Callicoat <diopter@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1482756
Change-Id: Ibc960564a3acfbb10cfbc3cfe0ad60d3366d2443
'}]
commit_message:
Add ebtables to neutron agent configuration

Neutron now uses ebtables as an extra security layer for ARP
spoof filtering. This patch adds the ebtables package and
rootwrap to the neutron role to ensure that the agent is able
to use this subsystem. Without it the networking from the
instances to the L3 router will fail.

Co-Authored-By: Evan Callicoat <diopter@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1482756
Change-Id: Ibc960564a3acfbb10cfbc3cfe0ad60d3366d2443

commit_message:
Refactor nova-network cases to neutron

- use neutron in tests migrate_vm_backed_with_ceph and
  check_ceph_partitions_after_reboot
- add primitives for requesting OVS database
- add showing "steps" from docstring into test cases
- refactor fuel master backup/restore helper methods

commit_message:
Dell SC: Fix error causing missed log message

Extremely trivial fix. An extra comma at the end of a
logging line actually made it into a statement that
doesn't perform logging. This patch removes the extra
comma so that the message gets logged as expected.

Change-Id: I032d5cdd54e3ed8924115744671d8ef9231e62c0

fuelmenu: check for APT repos only if Ubuntu based bootstrap is enabled

So the master node can be deployed without an Internet access if the
CentOS based bootstrap is used (which is the default).

commit_message:
Add more information show in v2

In v2, it's only show Id and Name. When use --verbose, although added
owner and status, it's still lack of Disk-format,Container-format and
Size.

Closes-bug:#1486329

[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-08-25 20:58:42.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/common/plugin/test_plugin.py', 'tests/unit/task/test_scenario.py', 'tests/unit/task/test_engine.py', 'tests/unit/test_docstrings.py', 'rally/task/scenario.py', 'tests/unit/cli/commands/test_info.py', 'tests/functional/test_cli_info.py', 'rally/common/plugin/meta.py', 'rally/task/engine.py', 'rally/exceptions.py', 'rally/task/types.py', 'tests/unit/task/test_types.py', 'rally/cli/commands/info.py', 'rally/common/plugin/plugin.py', 'rally/task/validation.py', 'tests/unit/doc/test_task_samples.py', 'tests/unit/task/test_runner.py', 'tests/unit/task/test_validation.py', 'tests/unit/common/plugin/test_meta.py', 'rally/task/runner.py'], 'message': "Switch scenarios plugins to plugin base

This patch finishes work on switching all plugin types
to the single code base. This reduce amount of code and unifies
all plugins which makes it simple to work on any kind of common
plugin functionality: Deprecation, Info, Validation and so on..
In this patch:
* Scenario.meta was removed and now MetaMixin is used
* ScenarioGroups are removed
  This reduce framework complexity. One thing less that you
  should know and understand to start.
* Scenario plugins can be explit set through configure()
  ** Unified with other kind of plugins
  ** Flexibility it is simpler to move and rename plugins
     with deprecation
* Remove all unused Scenario methods

* Improve rally.info substitution
it's okay if we specify each part of name of the plguin

Future steps (not in this patch) are:
* Refactor plugin info and reduce copy paste inside that module
* Refactor atomic action (make the work for context too)
* Refactor validation (make scenario validation generic enough
to work with all types of plugins)

Change-Id: Ibecb8006ebb5d670bcf4519e9f0d6a505e385a1a
"}]
commit_message:
Switch scenarios plugins to plugin base

This patch finishes work on switching all plugin types
to the single code base. This reduce amount of code and unifies
all plugins which makes it simple to work on any kind of common
plugin functionality: Deprecation, Info, Validation and so on..
In this patch:
* Scenario.meta was removed and now MetaMixin is used
* ScenarioGroups are removed
  This reduce framework complexity. One thing less that you
  should know and understand to start.
* Scenario plugins can be explit set through configure()
  ** Unified with other kind of plugins
  ** Flexibility it is simpler to move and rename plugins
     with deprecation
* Remove all unused Scenario methods

* Improve rally.info substitution
it's okay if we specify each part of name of the plguin

Future steps (not in this patch) are:
* Refactor plugin info and reduce copy paste inside that module
* Refactor atomic action (make the work for context too)
* Refactor validation (make scenario validation generic enough
to work with all types of plugins)

Change-Id: Ibecb8006ebb5d670bcf4519e9f0d6a505e385a1a

commit_message:
Implement Ansible role for Swift

This currently deploys the core services for a working Swift which are
account/container/object/proxy.

I've included some basic docs in docs/swift-related.rst, which gives
usage instructions and more context on this patch. These are really to
give an overview of the state of Swift in Kolla as of now, so unless
there's some major inaccuracy there please don't nitpick it.

Change-Id: Id0c54be3e24c46459c40b16b7020f05bddbe1b19
Implements: blueprint ansible-swift

commit_message:
Fix AttributeError in _clean_updated_sg_member_conntrack_entries()

The conntrack work that recently merged introduced a bug
due to an incorrect 'if' statement, it was only detecting
when one variable was not set instead of both, which can
cause an exception.  This is currently causing jenkins failures
with a number of other changes.

Introduced in Change Id Ibfd2d6a11aa970ea9e5009f4c4b858544d8b7463

Change-Id: I2519fdceefc9255c21d8226cdeffec40a7d444f6
Closes-bug: #1488284

commit_message:
Catch all the driver exceptions on node engine layer

Because all the exceptions from the drivers are considered
as senlin internal errors which are not desired to be returned
to user. So just catch all these exceptions on the engine layer
and store status and status_reason for the action.

Change-Id: I2975902ba5149aa9cb7bac5bb84684a8aa3db9c7

commit_message:
Fixed the SharedIp class

The SharedIp class was using name property of Network class
which have been removed in favor of describe() method, which should be
used in SharedIp now.

This has been addressed.

Closes-Bug: #1487013

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-08-24 20:55:07.000000000', 'files': ['manila/share/drivers/service_instance.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/test_service_instance.py', 'manila/test.py', 'manila/network/neutron/neutron_network_plugin.py'], 'message': 'Lazy Load Services

When the Manila share service starts, it instantiates
the Neutron network helper, which makes a call to the
Neutron service. If the service is started and the
Neutron service is unaccessible, the share service will
fail to even start.

This patch lazy loads those parameters so that they are
only loaded when needed (and presumably when the Neutron
service is up).

Change-Id: I1857c0cb6fc41afd0d01916addc1fd216070ffd7
Closes-Bug: #1481331
'}]
commit_message:
Lazy Load Services

When the Manila share service starts, it instantiates
the Neutron network helper, which makes a call to the
Neutron service. If the service is started and the
Neutron service is unaccessible, the share service will
fail to even start.

This patch lazy loads those parameters so that they are
only loaded when needed (and presumably when the Neutron
service is up).

Change-Id: I1857c0cb6fc41afd0d01916addc1fd216070ffd7
Closes-Bug: #1481331

commit_message:
Install lvm in Cinder from-source containers

lvm is required to integrate with Cinder with local storage.
Since local storage is an operation we support, we need this
package whether or not we keep udev sync disabled.

Tested all variants of centos+ubuntu+binary+source in
template and dockerfile format.

Change-Id: Icaeb2eeb588816d2f8a4b57f35fd43ddc56ff269
Partially-Implements: blueprint gate-source-builds

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-25 21:06:33.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-docker-utils/functions.sh'], 'message': "Fixing dockerctl restore/stop

This change fixes the stop_container logic so that it correctly passes
the keys from the CONTAINER_NAMES array to the stop_container function
when 'all' is given. Previously the logic was incorrectly passing the
values from the CONTAINER_NAMES array so the docker stop command was
failing as part of a restore or a stop all.

Change-Id: Id1d879ce9e4439b521a807e8e4abe18aada420a3
Related-Bug: 1485985
Closes-Bug: 1488541
"}]
commit_message:
Fixing dockerctl restore/stop

This change fixes the stop_container logic so that it correctly passes
the keys from the CONTAINER_NAMES array to the stop_container function
when 'all' is given. Previously the logic was incorrectly passing the
values from the CONTAINER_NAMES array so the docker stop command was
failing as part of a restore or a stop all.

Change-Id: Id1d879ce9e4439b521a807e8e4abe18aada420a3
Related-Bug: 1485985
Closes-Bug: 1488541

commit_message:
Implement ability to create VIPs that are not managed by Pacemaker

Pacemaker will manages only VIPs, which have non-empty 'namespace' parameter.
If plugin requires VIP just for address reservation VIP should contain
empty 'namespace' field.

Change-Id: I3df45259b9f74e114eaaeaa28c47c5461a87f4a9
Closes-bug: 1487117

revisions:

Change-Id: I391818b47956796dd01a1b3df28fb60a6bc7844c

commit_message:
archive policy rule: make them available on all metric creations

Currently the archive policy rules are only applied when creating metric
in certain manners. This patches change that so that anyway you create
the metric, the archive policy rules are applied.

It also optimizes the metric creation process to avoid an archive policy
lookup on metric creation.

Change-Id: I391818b47956796dd01a1b3df28fb60a6bc7844c

subject: file: store measures atomically
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-08-26 08:17:13.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/storage/file.py'], 'message': "file: store measures atomically

There's a (rare) condition possible where gnocchi-metricd would read a
non-completely written measure file. We change that by writing these
measure files in a temporary directory and then renaming them
atomically.

Change-Id: Ib78de8b09f265291cf0353514ace402d706bc67e
"}]
commit_message:
file: store measures atomically

There's a (rare) condition possible where gnocchi-metricd would read a
non-completely written measure file. We change that by writing these
measure files in a temporary directory and then renaming them
atomically.

Change-Id: Ib78de8b09f265291cf0353514ace402d706bc67e

This patchset implements:
* remove proxy-arp artefects
* replace internal (broken in ubuntu) Send Gratuitous ARP manner to arping
* optimize monitor() method
* remove ifconfig usage. Only iproute2 used.
* remove NIC parameter. Only bridges may be connected with network namespace without proxy-arp.
* remove unused parameters
* remove setup forwarding (not need more for bridging + veth-pairs usage)
* use arping instead icmp ping, because no IP address from VIP subnet on host system allowed.

Change-Id: I0d545567de84e13bf88fd95e2fc13a03378693b0
Closes-bug: 1485951
'}]
commit_message:
Remove PROXY-ARP artifacts from ns_IPaddr2 OCF script

This patchset implements:
* remove proxy-arp artefects
* replace internal (broken in ubuntu) Send Gratuitous ARP manner to arping
* optimize monitor() method
* remove ifconfig usage. Only iproute2 used.
* remove NIC parameter. Only bridges may be connected with network namespace without proxy-arp.
* remove unused parameters
* remove setup forwarding (not need more for bridging + veth-pairs usage)
* use arping instead icmp ping, because no IP address from VIP subnet on host system allowed.

Change-Id: I0d545567de84e13bf88fd95e2fc13a03378693b0
Closes-bug: 1485951

commit_message:
Standardise help parameter of CLI commands

When typed the command like bellow,
some parameters help have a full stop(.), and others have not.
murano --help
--version    show program's version number and exit
--include-password    Send os-username and os-password to murano.
--murano-repo-url MURANO_REPO_URL
            Defaults to env[MURANO_REPO_URL] or
            http://storage.apps.openstack.org

Change-Id: I893654efe2aeac08fb8b2621cf29ad95ca16a113
Closes-Bug: #1488345

subject: No More .reload_backends() or .reload_backend()
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-25 22:53:46.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_ldap_livetest.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_backend_ldap.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/backend/core_ldap.py'], 'message': 'No More .reload_backends() or .reload_backend()

The LDAP test code did a lot of lazy reloading of backends to validate
configuration values would have intended results. The result of the
reload is far more impactful and causes a repopulation of data. This
patch eliminates the calls to .reload_backends and .reload_backend by
setting the values expected directly on the LDAP manager objects.

Change-Id: I8a4736f28e7965940ec1eb402c4913652df23ae3
'}]
commit_message:
No More .reload_backends() or .reload_backend()

The LDAP test code did a lot of lazy reloading of backends to validate
configuration values would have intended results. The result of the
reload is far more impactful and causes a repopulation of data. This
patch eliminates the calls to .reload_backends and .reload_backend by
setting the values expected directly on the LDAP manager objects.

Change-Id: I8a4736f28e7965940ec1eb402c4913652df23ae3

commit_message:
Ensure ephemeral user's user_id is url-safe

As a principle, an attribute ``user_id`` should always be url safe and
we should make sure this is the case especially for the federated
authentication workflow as user name and id can be provided directly
from the user (either hardcoded in the mapping rule or passed as a
parameter from the assertion).

Change-Id: I7256a5e4d31d3c2e55fe956fb0170452bb241078
Closes-Bug: #1487115

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-04-07 07:05:11.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/ilo/deploy.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/ilo/test_deploy.py'], 'message': "localboot deploy fails for iscsi_ilo driver

Deploy fails when node is configured with 'properties'/'capabilities'
to 'secure_boot':'true' and 'boot_option':'local' for iscsi_ilo
driver.

When localboot deploy happens, ironic do not install signed
bootloaders. This leads to node not booting up during second reboot
when node is configured for UEFI secure boot.

Change-Id: I88352da21b6a0f4fe165bc8a27a495699e12d1ff
Closes-Bug: 1437777
"}]
commit_message:
localboot deploy fails for iscsi_ilo driver

Deploy fails when node is configured with 'properties'/'capabilities'
to 'secure_boot':'true' and 'boot_option':'local' for iscsi_ilo
driver.

When localboot deploy happens, ironic do not install signed
bootloaders. This leads to node not booting up during second reboot
when node is configured for UEFI secure boot.

Change-Id: I88352da21b6a0f4fe165bc8a27a495699e12d1ff
Closes-Bug: 1437777

commit_message:
Adds oslo.windows governance

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/oslo.windows

Hyper-V is involved in many of OpenStack components (nova, neutron,
cinder, ceilometer, etc.) and will be involved with other components
in the future.

A common library can be created in order to reduce the code duplication
between all these components (utils classes, which interacts directly
with Hyper-V through WMI), making it easier to maintain, review and
propose new changes to current and future components.

Change-Id: I0beded6426137a238a482e09983975d1782349c2
Depends-On: I951d7baf6b20c9d16f7ce8a76ddc21af4ced4c6a
Implements: blueprint oslo.windows

commit_message:
WIP: Adds oslo.windows project proposal spec

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/oslo.windows

Hyper-V is involved in many of OpenStack components (nova, neutron,
cinder, ceilometer, etc.) and will be involved with other components
in the future.

A common library can be created in order to reduce the code duplication
between all these components (utils classes, which interacts directly
with Hyper-V through WMI), making it easier to maintain, review and
propose new changes to current and future components.

Change-Id: Ie53c4567d58efedd93b6b31bd4678c4bdb3f583a
Implements: blueprint oslo.windows

commit_message:
Define _build_connection_params in policy base module

This patch moves the definition of _build_connection_params from
lb_policy module to policy base module. Then all policies can
invoke this function to generate parameters for sdk connection.
This patch also revise the implementation of _build_connection_params
function defined in profile base module to avoid scope conflict with
trusts.

Change-Id: Ia3fd89ea771e7f66d60ac2f616820115ee40db95

commit_message:
Add iRMC Virtual Media Deploy module for iRMC Driver

This module enables PXE/TFTP less deployment capability to provision
PRIMERGY bare metal nodes (having iRMC S4 and beyond) by booting the
bare metal node with virtual media using NFS or CIFS from conductor
node to deploy the image.

Implements: blueprint irmc-virtualmedia-deploy-driver
Change-Id: I747b3245c7ba5e991abb07c894c8cd2b2d3c45e8

commit_message:
Fixed logic for tempest tests reporting

For now we don't use In Progress status during the tests execution
and also we use Failed status if deployment of master node will fail.
We need to change this logic and start to change status of test cases
to In Progress during the tests execution and Blocked in case of
some issues during master node failures or cloud deployment issues.

Closes-Bug: #1487470

Change-Id: Id1112f470c6470e0cb741a5327511d49db8f548c

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-25 06:16:34.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Allow pep8 of a single file

Now you can run

   $ tox -e pep8 path/to/file.py [path/to/file2.py [...]]

to run pep8 against just those files[1]. This is quite a bit faster
than a full pep8 run, and the faster feedback is nice when you're
fiddling with some formatting to placate pep8.

Of course, you can still run "tox -e pep8" to check the whole source
tree, just as before this commit.

[1] It'll still run against bin/swift* as well, but that's still a lot
faster than running against all our .py files.

Change-Id: I81b4363fb95a34ff0f5c346b2b24f2047154f502
'}]
commit_message:
Allow pep8 of a single file

Now you can run

   $ tox -e pep8 path/to/file.py [path/to/file2.py [...]]

to run pep8 against just those files[1]. This is quite a bit faster
than a full pep8 run, and the faster feedback is nice when you're
fiddling with some formatting to placate pep8.

Of course, you can still run "tox -e pep8" to check the whole source
tree, just as before this commit.

[1] It'll still run against bin/swift* as well, but that's still a lot
faster than running against all our .py files.

Change-Id: I81b4363fb95a34ff0f5c346b2b24f2047154f502

subject: Removed default lxc profile on container create
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-08-25 13:15:45.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/rsyslog-install.yml', 'playbooks/galera-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-neutron-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-heat-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-nova-install.yml', 'playbooks/rabbitmq-install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/lxc_container_create/tasks/container_create.yml', 'playbooks/os-glance-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-ceilometer-install.yml', 'playbooks/memcached-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-swift-setup.yml', 'playbooks/os-horizon-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-keystone-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-cinder-install.yml', 'playbooks/utility-install.yml', 'playbooks/repo-server.yml'], 'message': 'Removed default lxc profile on container create

Having the lxc container create role drop the lxc-openstack apparmor
profile on all containers anytime its executed leads to the possibility
of the lxc container create task overwriting the running profile on a given
container. If this happens its likley to cause service interruption until the
correct profile is loaded for all containers its effected by the action.

To fix this issue the default "lxc-openstack" profile has been removed from the
lxc contianer create task and added to all plays that are known to be executed
within an lxc container. This will ensure that the profile is untouched on
subsequent runs of the lxc-container-create.yml play.

Change-Id: Ifa4640be60c18f1232cc7c8b281fb1dfc0119e56
Closes-Bug: 1487130
'}]
commit_message:
Removed default lxc profile on container create

Having the lxc container create role drop the lxc-openstack apparmor
profile on all containers anytime its executed leads to the possibility
of the lxc container create task overwriting the running profile on a given
container. If this happens its likley to cause service interruption until the
correct profile is loaded for all containers its effected by the action.

To fix this issue the default "lxc-openstack" profile has been removed from the
lxc contianer create task and added to all plays that are known to be executed
within an lxc container. This will ensure that the profile is untouched on
subsequent runs of the lxc-container-create.yml play.

Change-Id: Ifa4640be60c18f1232cc7c8b281fb1dfc0119e56
Closes-Bug: 1487130

commit_message:
Angular metadata update modal

This patch adds metadata update modal dialog widet written in js
and some required REST API methods.

To see it in action checkout following patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/184275/
which replaces old metadata modals with new ones written in angular.

Co-Authored-By: Shaoquan Chen <sean.chen2@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Rajat Vig <rajatv@thoughtworks.com>

Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-metadata-update-modals
Change-Id: I36bfb91f8b6bbba49fed6bb01cd1dd266261cfdb

commit_message:
Correct local_settings example from overwriting settings

Currently, local_settings.py.example redefines HORIZON_CONFIG
(previously defined in settings.py). This adds to confusion as to
where proper definitions and modifications should be made.
This change ensures that only modifications of HORIZON_CONFIG
are made within local_settings.py.example and defining of
HORIZON_CONFIG is left in settings.py.

-added importing of HORIZON_CONFIG from settings

-corrected portion that was redefining HORIZON_CONFIG

-left the modal_backdrop = static change that was
occuring in the redefition in local_settings to
that of a modification and commented out to serve
as an example (conforms to usual pattern)

-migrated the default for 'modal_backdrop'
into settings.py

Change-Id: I7ddeee82258f6c871ff77e1bc03115c2adbf618e
Closes-Bug: #1472687

commit_message:

Now that all calls that previously used conductor vol_usage_update()
have been converted to objects, lets clean out the unused code in
conductor.

Change-Id: I7d7930fbcc748587d3278c128802dcebedbba892

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-08-24 14:24:18.000000000', 'files': ['nova/test.py', 'nova/tests/unit/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Move objects registration in tests directory

In order to use a NovaObject via the magic objects.Foo syntax
objects.register_all() must have been called first.  This was being done
in nova/test.py which most files in the test directory imported due to
TestCase being defined there.

Files in the test directory which provides fakes for use in testing do
not typically import nova.test and were not able to use objects.Foo to
instantiate an object.  This moves the objects registration to
tests/unit/__init__.py so that all modules in the unit tests directory
can access objects in the same way.  Since fakes are usually defined in
the unit tests dir this does not change anything for tests/functional/.

Change-Id: I7dee851cb4c37af3becf948cb55da5ee011a1e5e
'}]
commit_message:
Move objects registration in tests directory

In order to use a NovaObject via the magic objects.Foo syntax
objects.register_all() must have been called first.  This was being done
in nova/test.py which most files in the test directory imported due to
TestCase being defined there.

Files in the test directory which provides fakes for use in testing do
not typically import nova.test and were not able to use objects.Foo to
instantiate an object.  This moves the objects registration to
tests/unit/__init__.py so that all modules in the unit tests directory
can access objects in the same way.  Since fakes are usually defined in
the unit tests dir this does not change anything for tests/functional/.

Change-Id: I7dee851cb4c37af3becf948cb55da5ee011a1e5e

commit_message:
rest: Pass the project name to middleware config

Now oslo.middleware middlewares can read options from the application
configuration file if we pass the project name in the 'oslo_config_project'
option.

This change adds that. Now all oslo.middleware middlewares are usable
with gnocchi.

Change-Id: Id9625622be2727bf07c40d5b70c72282a1f6c7b8

  do not exist in stable/kilo.

(cherry picked from commit b36f4da1925f7be9e0eadb057753241450135364)
'}]
commit_message:
Revert failing tests and use v3 for ec2 tokens

Domain users are not supported anymore on v2, so we need to use v3 by
default when authenticating ec2 access.

Conflicts:

- heat/api/aws/ec2token.py: The version discovery code in master was not
  present in stable/kilo, so only half of the fix to master applies to
  stable/kilo.

- heat_integrationtests/scenario/test_ceilometer_alarm.py: These tests
  do not exist in stable/kilo.

Change-Id: Ia7ca08bca612b4555f6b4d9098cd7db6c540b1c4
Closes-Bug: #1484086
(cherry picked from commit b36f4da1925f7be9e0eadb057753241450135364)

* Set crypt_strength min and max according to passlib API
  documentation minimum and a reasonable maximum.  Used the following
  as a guide:  http://paste.openstack.org/show/427243/
* Set a minimum appropriate key_size of keys used for certificates

commit_message:
Use min and max on IntOpt option types

* Set crypt_strength min and max according to passlib API
  documentation minimum and a reasonable maximum.  Used the following
  as a guide:  http://paste.openstack.org/show/427243/
* Set a minimum appropriate key_size of keys used for certificates
* pydev-debug-port, public_port, and admin_port min max set according
  to the range available for a TCP port.

Closes-Bug: #1487960

Change-Id: I71112c569b965896a409c5f8559c38488c2249c9

This change enables collection of memory metrics through the libvirt
plugin, if supported by the guest OS.  Documentation included.

It also fixes a benign OS error that may occur if the libvirt plugin's
ping_check is deactivated through monasca-setup.

Auto-detection of the agent's OS username has been added, as has
auto-detection of the nova configuration file, as these hard-coded
values have proven to be unreliable in various environments.

Change-Id: I78dc3eacde46654e5c1f47e0e685ff5b5c8a0e5c
"}]
commit_message:
Add VM memory metrics to libvirt plugin

This change enables collection of memory metrics through the libvirt
plugin, if supported by the guest OS.  Documentation included.

It also fixes a benign OS error that may occur if the libvirt plugin's
ping_check is deactivated through monasca-setup.

Auto-detection of the agent's OS username has been added, as has
auto-detection of the nova configuration file, as these hard-coded
values have proven to be unreliable in various environments.

Change-Id: I78dc3eacde46654e5c1f47e0e685ff5b5c8a0e5c

subject: Speedup Git Cloning Ansible Repository
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-26 03:54:04.000000000', 'files': ['docker/centos/binary/kolla-ansible/Dockerfile', 'docker_templates/kolla-ansible/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': 'Speedup Git Cloning Ansible Repository

When building kolla-ansible image, it clones ansible source code from
github. Since we just need the source code but not the commit history,
there is no need to download all the commit log objects. This patch adds
"--depth 1" option to git clone command. This will speedup kolla-ansible
image building a lot, especially in countries with slow Internet access.

Change-Id: I834f83a127350415a5861a2f5b2982df3d3e3f5a
Closes-Bug: #1488744
'}]
commit_message:
Speedup Git Cloning Ansible Repository

When building kolla-ansible image, it clones ansible source code from
github. Since we just need the source code but not the commit history,
there is no need to download all the commit log objects. This patch adds
"--depth 1" option to git clone command. This will speedup kolla-ansible
image building a lot, especially in countries with slow Internet access.

Change-Id: I834f83a127350415a5861a2f5b2982df3d3e3f5a
Closes-Bug: #1488744

commit_message:
Enable barbican in devstack

Magnum will use barbican to store CA and magnum client certs for
TLS support. This patch adds barbican service to devstack
configuration.

Change-Id: Id112699be08788466e7cd9806082e150cbdc15e2
Partial-Implements: blueprint magnum-as-a-ca

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-18 22:15:07.000000000', 'files': ['reference/extra-atcs'], 'message': 'Temporarily add I18n ATCs

Because there is no automatic method to recognize the active contributors
of I18n team, we have to use this temporary way to add I18n ATCs,
to get the vote right and discount code for translators.
After we officially move to Zanata, there could be an automatic way
to get the I18n ATC list. At that time, the naming list will be removed
from here.

Change-Id: I7be23b2bca64a9d78a5be18941e0398171422936
'}]
commit_message:
Temporarily add I18n ATCs

Because there is no automatic method to recognize the active contributors
of I18n team, we have to use this temporary way to add I18n ATCs,
to get the vote right and discount code for translators.
After we officially move to Zanata, there could be an automatic way
to get the I18n ATC list. At that time, the naming list will be removed
from here.

Change-Id: I7be23b2bca64a9d78a5be18941e0398171422936

subject: Gate ceilometer on its plugin-based grenade job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-14 08:51:01.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Gate ceilometer on its plugin-based grenade job

Make the experimental grenade-dsvm-ceilometer voting and drop
ceilometer from the standard grenade.

The experimental job has been running well for a significant number
of tests but is in the awkward state of upgrading ceilometer twice
because ceilometer remains in core grenade. It is removed in the
depend-on patch below.

Depends-On: I09f47a8c24ac59e5db840bcbc7970bfb5d259591
Change-Id: I2517bfde5795bd98e9a89e416445f1c04c8b51a3
'}]
commit_message:
Gate ceilometer on its plugin-based grenade job

Make the experimental grenade-dsvm-ceilometer voting and drop
ceilometer from the standard grenade.

The experimental job has been running well for a significant number
of tests but is in the awkward state of upgrading ceilometer twice
because ceilometer remains in core grenade. It is removed in the
depend-on patch below.

Depends-On: I09f47a8c24ac59e5db840bcbc7970bfb5d259591
Change-Id: I2517bfde5795bd98e9a89e416445f1c04c8b51a3

commit_message:
Update tests to reflect WSME 0.8 fixes

Before WSME would ignore fields that didn't exist in the resource, but
with the version 0.8.0 WSME will raise HTTP 400 (BadRequest) when one
attempt to create a resource with nonexistent fields.

Change-Id: Ie6a80ee03428b98c72e3704202b2b5cbfce93ab6

Remove debug log message in SG API constructor

It was added when changed from a singleton pattern to an instance object
pattern and is just noise in the logs.

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2015-08-20 11:53:15.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/test_common.py', 'nova/api/openstack/common.py'], 'message': 'Added processing /compute URL

After implementing blueprint "Ability to run some Nova services under Apache2"(
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/run-nova-services-under-apache2)
it becomes possible not to use separate ports for each openstack service but
share 80 port with different URL prefixes. Mailing list thread with
discussion the details of this feature:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/067147.html.
Openstack wiki page with mapping urls to services:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/URLs.
Function remove_version_from_href was corrected: API version must be present
in the end of SCRIPT_NAME.
Devstack has been updated here: Ic84b5c0dc0726662470ef9c076a0cadca55a3917

If nova-api service is started by Apache (or similar),
using 'Alias' directive script name contains alias-prefix.
We get things like: '/ALIAS/NAME/v2', '/ALIAS/NAME/v2.1'

This change makes sure we remove only the last part of URL,
to make sure we don't hit problems where ALIAS has a version in it.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1486447
Change-Id: I83bc4731507fa028377ae6701ed4d32adefa9251
'}]
commit_message:
Added processing /compute URL

After implementing blueprint "Ability to run some Nova services under Apache2"(
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/run-nova-services-under-apache2)
it becomes possible not to use separate ports for each openstack service but
share 80 port with different URL prefixes. Mailing list thread with
discussion the details of this feature:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/067147.html.
Openstack wiki page with mapping urls to services:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/URLs.
Function remove_version_from_href was corrected: API version must be present
in the end of SCRIPT_NAME.
Devstack has been updated here: Ic84b5c0dc0726662470ef9c076a0cadca55a3917

If nova-api service is started by Apache (or similar),
using 'Alias' directive script name contains alias-prefix.
We get things like: '/ALIAS/NAME/v2', '/ALIAS/NAME/v2.1'

This change makes sure we remove only the last part of URL,
to make sure we don't hit problems where ALIAS has a version in it.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1486447
Change-Id: I83bc4731507fa028377ae6701ed4d32adefa9251

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-25 16:21:08.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/api/openstack/test_versioned_method.py', 'manila/tests/api/test_versions.py', 'doc/source/devref/experimental_apis.rst', 'manila/api/openstack/api_version_request.py', 'doc/source/devref/index.rst', 'manila/api/openstack/versioned_method.py', 'manila/api/openstack/wsgi.py', 'manila/tests/api/openstack/test_api_version_request.py'], 'message': 'Manila experimental REST APIs

Manila uses API microversions to allow natural evolution of its REST APIs
over time.  But microversions alone cannot solve the question of how to
ship APIs that are experimental in nature, are expected to change at any
time, and could even be removed entirely without a typical deprecation
period.

Working in conjunction with microversions, this commit adds a facility
for marking individual REST APIs as experimental.

Implements bp: manila-experimental-rest-apis

Change-Id: I263a0b5579a7eb2fe98ca810ad3dec6719d66e6f
'}]
commit_message:
Manila experimental REST APIs

Manila uses API microversions to allow natural evolution of its REST APIs
over time.  But microversions alone cannot solve the question of how to
ship APIs that are experimental in nature, are expected to change at any
time, and could even be removed entirely without a typical deprecation
period.

Working in conjunction with microversions, this commit adds a facility
for marking individual REST APIs as experimental.

Implements bp: manila-experimental-rest-apis

Change-Id: I263a0b5579a7eb2fe98ca810ad3dec6719d66e6f

Instead of hard-coding advanced services, like vpnaas, with the ServiceTypeManager,

commit_message:
Register provider configuration with ServiceTypeManager

Instead of hard-coding advanced services, like vpnaas, with the ServiceTypeManager,
this change makes the registration explicit by leveraging the newly introduced API
add_provider_configuration.
Some unit testing refactoring was required to reduce code duplication and to deal
with the new way service providers are processed.

Related-bug: #1473110

Change-Id: I8924234aadf786801ffc100d7daa27acc145a195

commit_message:
Proper deprecation for CredentialManager data argument

CredentialManager's data argument wasn't properly deprecated since
the deprecation was only mentioned in the docstring. Proper
deprecation requires use of warnings/debtcollector and
documentation.

bp deprecations

Change-Id: Ibdb4bda622119eec963ce5b57673dc01ff279b0e

commit_message:
Document OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_ADMIN_ROLES

OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_ADMIN_ROLES was added in Kilo and used by
django_openstack_auth. However, it was never documented. Adding now.

Closes-Bug: #1488154
Change-Id: I0ba4e15677d62e1176dc51456b1e2728640149e9
